Job Description:
Charger Logistics is a world class asset-based carrier. We specialize in delivering assets, on time and on budget. With the diverse fleet of equipment, we can handle a range of freight, including dedicated loads, specialized hauls, temperature-controlled goods and HAZMAT cargo. We invest our time and support the employees to provide them with the room to learn and grow their expertise and work their way up. We are entrepreneurial-minded organization that welcomes and support individual idea and strategies.
We are looking for a Data Scientist who uses a combination of techniques from statistics, machine learning, computer science and data visualization to produce advanced predictive analytic solutions that determine patterns and relationships in large volumes of data to predict future behaviors, events and outcomes. The candidate will work cross-functionally with technical and non-technical teams to take on a variety of tasks including but not limited to mining data, building models, building dashboards, and conducting detailed analysis. The ideal candidate will have a analytical mindset, deep understanding of databases, visualization, and modeling techniques, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment delivering against tight deadlines.
Responsibilities:
Understand the business requirements and processes around advanced analytics model execution.
Collect data from disparate structured and unstructured sources in support of model development.
Extract data using data mining techniques to uncover trends and derive insights; analyze forecasting metrics,
Perform exploratory data analysis with the goal to uncover trends, find root causes of forecast inaccuracies and develop innovative features that can drive additional value
Build machine learning models with advanced analytics techniques to extend our capabilities and deliver new business value.
Capture and present data-driven business insights
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation
Work closely with software engineering teams to drive real-time model implementations and new feature creations
Leverage existing data sources, identify and mine data from new sources, identify opportunities for and execute primary data gathering efforts, and provide recommendations on scaling new methods more broadly
Requirements:
University degree or equivalent in data analytics, statistics, math, or computer science, with a minimum of 2 years relevant experience.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to translate/communicate analytics recommendations to both technical and nontechnical team members.
Strong understanding of quantitative (univariate and multivariate) analysis techniques.
Experience with predictive modelling and machine learning.
Strong experience with statistical analytical techniques, data mining, machine learning, and predictive models using Python, R or similar tools
Experience using scripting language for collecting, organizing and manipulating data.
Ability to work with data with significant ambiguity, develop creative approaches to analytical problems, and interpret data and results from a business/industry perspective

We are looking for our next Junior Data Scientist. Could it be you?
The Junior Data Scientist will be a part of our Marketing Consumer Insights and Analytics team. Reporting into the Director, Strategy, Consumer Insights and Analytics, this role will focus on developing and applying machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to support consumer marketing strategies at M&M Food Market. They will work closely with the IT, eCommerce, and Business Intelligence teams, as well as other key internal stakeholders, to research data science models and oversee end-to-end implementation. The Junior Data Scientist will lead research projects to solve the ongoing challenges while mentoring and supporting other team members.
Need more details? Keep reading…
The Junior Data Scientist will be responsible for but not limited to:
Define data science projects from start to finish, identifying opportunities, defining the problem, building a proof of concept, and deploying a data product to improve marketing, product development, or overall business strategies
Conduct data mining on customer, product, sales, assortment data sources for insights; generate hypotheses to test for opportunities to understand consumer behaviour and improve the merchandising and planning processes
Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions and projects in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals.
Apply a wide range of statistical and quantitative analysis in practical and valuable ways
Design custom tools to optimize data mining, cleaning, validation and analysis tasks
Develop tools and testing models to ensure data accuracy
Use predictive modeling to optimize marketing campaigns and customer experiences
Participate in design workshops and document business requirements and constraints
Program and write maintainable and well-documented scripts/applications for process automation; produce reusable machine learning pipelines while model building
Connect with other teams to understand the go-to-market process, product lifecycle, and product/consumer strategy
Create rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources; communicate results to senior leadership
Propose solutions and strategies to business opportunities and challenges
So are you our next Junior Data Scientist? You could be if you are a curious self-starter who is an insightful, results-orientated, and motivated professional with exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. You have a proven ability to conduct thorough analysis using multiple data sources, evaluate and present visual results in Tableau. The Junior Data Scientist requires the ability to understand a concept from a broader perspective with strong problem-solving skills. You are adaptable and love working with people and teams from diverse skillsets and backgrounds, in a highly collaborative working environment.
Experience, Education, and Designations:
1+ years of work experience in data science, preferably in retail food service industry including internships
Academic background in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Research, or a related field
Must have experience with Tableau and Python (Jupyter, NumPy, Pandas, PySpark)
Strong SQL and/or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Experience in at least one of the common data science toolkits, such as scikit learn, Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.
Demonstrated experience applying machine learning and data mining techniques
Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:
Strong problem solving and analytical skills including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization through Tableau
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including reports and presentations
Strong technical attitude – ability to turn business problems into analytical solution
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results
Ability to take on responsibilities and work with minimal supervision
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships
Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same

About the role
Airudi is looking for an applied data scientist to discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and to build the AI models that will enable Human Resources professionals to make smarter decisions.
Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our cloud native solutions.
This is a position for a hands-on data scientist that offers you the opportunity to work with data and software practitioners on the one hand and with academic researchers on the other hand. You'll be part of a diverse, multi-disciplinary team including software and machine learning developers, HR specialists, designers, data scientists and AI researchers.
Responsibilities
· Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
· Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
· Extending Airudi’s data with third party sources of information when needed
· Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
· Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
· Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
· Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance
· Collaborate with business subject matter experts, technical professionals and academic researchers
· Maintain state-of-the-art data science experience through continuous learning and share knowledge within the team
· Provide and promote data science excellence to support multiple initiatives in parallel
Skills and qualifications

· Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as deep learning, k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.

Assets

À propos
Airudi est à la recherche d'un spécialiste des données appliquées pour découvrir les informations cachées dans de vastes quantités de données et pour créer les modèles d'IA qui permettront aux professionnels des ressources humaines de prendre des décisions plus intelligentes.
Votre objectif principal sera d'appliquer des techniques d'exploration de données, d'effectuer des analyses statistiques et de créer des systèmes de prédiction de haute qualité intégrés à nos solutions cloud.
Il s'agit d'un poste pour un scientifique des données « hands-on » qui offre la possibilité de travailler avec des praticiens des données et des logiciels d'une part et avec des chercheurs universitaires d'autre part.
Vous ferez partie d'une équipe diversifiée et multidisciplinaire comprenant des développeurs logiciels et d'apprentissage automatique, des spécialistes des ressources humaines, des concepteurs, des scientifiques des données et des chercheurs en IA.

· Collaborer avec des experts en affaires, des professionnels techniques et des chercheurs universitaires
· Maintenir une expérience de pointe en science des données grâce à un apprentissage continu et partager les connaissances au sein de l'équipe

Position Title – Data Analyst
Location – Edmonton, AB
Experience: 7+ Years
Roles, Responsibilities and Qualifications
Role Description
A Data Analyst provides expertise in instrumentation and data collection, data-driven storytelling, statistical analysis, modelling and data visualizations, developing data policies and governance standards, and developing service analytics standards and practices (inclusive of both digital and non-digital service implementation).
Responsibilities
a) Creates plans and strategies that will identify the various linkages between new and existing data forms, resulting in the integration of data models, development of data policies, and presentation of statistical analysis and data visualizations to help understand and improve service delivery online and offline.
b) Supports governance based on the service data model, service analytics standards, and the development of analytics tools, inclusive of both digital and non-digital service implementation.
c) Works to implement develop, and share service metrics and service performance dashboards for internal and public use.
d) Facilitates and informs program area workshops about current data and performance practices.
e) Uses the service journey to frame future measurement models.
f) Mentors team members and others to develop and grow their analytics fluency.
g) Researches best practices and makes recommendations for the direction of data-driven governance policies to support the adoption of digital services, and service delivery information management.
h) Creates data statistical analysis and data visualizations leveraging data querying languages within available data management technologies.
i) Supports corporate priorities based upon data-driven evidence by leveraging existing and new analytics, data visualizations, data modeling and storytelling.
j) Other responsibilities as required or requested.
Qualifications
a) Experience leading data science and analytics work, including digital and non-digital services.
b) Experience with leadership, communications, relationship building, and planning.
c) Experience with current methodologies in analytics, data visualizations, data modeling and storytelling.
d) Experience working with cross-functional teams to understand detailed requirements and align these requirements with product vision and user needs.
e) Experience working in a complex enterprise environment (10,000 employees or greater).
f) Experience with agile projects in a public sector organization.
g) Experience with web development and digital product design.
h) Experience providing analytics support to user experience, customer experience, or service design teams.
i) Experience with quantitative research methods such as surveys.
j) Experience developing and maintaining relationships with multiple clients and stakeholders, including negotiating agreements and resolving conflicts.

We are redefining access to credit with our revolutionary technology that uses machine learning and automation capabilities to deliver better, simpler financial services to everyone.
We are looking for a talented, enthusiastic, and results-driven Analytics Data Scientist to join our growing team of data scientists who will be responsible for responding to analytics requests, managing data assets, developing predictive and forecasting analytics solutions in support of the organization’s lending decisions across all aspects of Growth, Marketing, Product, Credit, Operations and Finance.
The ideal candidate should have a strong academic background in data mining and predictive modeling. The candidate should have a great sense of data and ideally would have some relevant experiences in the lending, credit, fraud, banking, and financial services industries. The candidate is an avid and quick learner of new concepts, skills, and technologies, and has a strong ability to conduct research and convert knowledge to solutions.
What You’ll Do
Develop actionable analytics insights for continuous enhancement of lending business management in all aspects of credit risk, policy and strategy, marketing and sales, account behavior, and collections.

Perform other business analyses duties as assigned.

4+ years of experience. Highly skilled in data processing and predictive model development with strong analytical, conceptual and quantitative problem-solving skills.
Bachelors, Master or Ph.D. Degree, preferably in a quantitative area such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering and economics.

Familiarity with ML and AI services on leading public cloud providers: Google Cloud ML.Knowledge of the lending consumer with knowledge of credit, banking, finance, a plus.

Sound project and time management skills.

Job Title: Director, Data Governance and Enterprise Analytics
Job Description:
Company Bio
IMAGINE a hospital where everyone is committed to excellence. We did. We are. From boardroom to bedside, we go above and beyond to offer the best and safest patient care. At North York General Hospital (NYGH), we put our patients first in everything we do. We are achieving a new standard of excellence in integrated patient-centered care and as one of Canada's leading community academic hospitals, we are building on our academic foundation through enhanced education, research and innovation. North York General Hospital is part of North York Toronto Health Partners, a collaborative partnership with patients, primary care, and community partners, a first- generation Ontario Health Team, driving the development of a locally integrated health system to serve the community. As part of our dynamic team, you too can stand out and be amazing! At North York General, our team is making a world of difference. #LI-BR1 #NYGHIndeed
Position Summary
Director, Data Governance and Enterprise Analytics
You will provide leadership to the Decision Support/Business Intelligence (BI) and Health Information Management (HIM) teams. As a senior leader, you will establish and oversee a team of subject matter experts on health information management, advanced analytics and data engineering to foster best practices and consistent approaches/methodologies across the organization. You will have accountability for the organization’s analytics strategy and decision support/BI services, building capability for the advanced use of data and analytics to support strategy, operations, performance measurement and analytics informed decision making across the organization. This position supports the hospital’s academic mandate by advancing care through teaching and learning and/or transforming care through research and innovation. This position will also provide leadership and support to a broad range of strategic activities and partnerships including North York Toronto Health Partners (OHT).
On a practical level, you will
Advance the Organizational Data and Analytics Strategy

Develop and oversee the organization’s analytics strategy including the ongoing development and implementation of strategies and partnerships related to data, information systems, tools business intelligence platforms, processes, and the expertise required to aggregate, transform, analyze, report, and use data to support strategy, operations and to advance the use of analytics informed decision making across the organization, and with researchers and community partnerships.

Execute the strategy and management of information management and analytics/decision support and data visualization services, and transformation of how NYGH uses and works with data.

Provides expertise and consults on all new major data-related or data-intensive initiatives
Organizational capacity development

Build an effective, flexible, and results-oriented analytics team that focuses on generating meaningful business analytics and strategic insights. Identify key indicators, strong use-cases and create descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytical models to unlock the value of the hospital’s data.

Grow and foster either organically or through partnership, the data science function to focus on complex data pipelines, data engineering, and data modeling and drive increased production of analytical models.

Operationalize actionable analytics across teams, including the development of sustainable and modernized data models for key business areas, building analytical capabilities across the organization and identifying innovative opportunities.

Coach, mentor and develop individuals and teams to enhance their knowledge, experience, and skills.
Data Governance

Develop and establish an organizational data governance framework that supports the ability of the organization to ensure data is accessible, of high quality, and compliant with relevant policies, legislation, and regulatory requirements.

Enable organization efficiency through the provision of data stewardship and data subject matter expertise and provide oversight of the data lifecycle for each data asset.

Ensure that robust processes and tools are in place to validate, process and accurately report and analyze data.

Improve how the organization collects, uses, manages, and publishes data.

Lead the organization’s efforts to track data collections, data purchases, databases, physical data models, and linkages between datasets.

Decrease the cost of managing data and increase the value of organization’s data
Health Information Management

In compliance with relevant legislative and regulatory requirements, works to advance how the organizations manages health information, data submission and reporting and other requirements of the Health Information Management function.

Works with the team to introduce and implement innovation in HIM function and performance

Insights to inform organizational strategy and performance

Collaborate closely and provide analytical support to the Senior Leadership, Clinical, Support and Research & Education teams to develop innovative information systems and tools that support the strategic initiatives to advance the Hospital’s research, education, and clinical care delivery mandates.

Develop a hospital wide performance measurement and reporting strategy, continuously streamlining, and aligning strategic and operation measurement tools to support performance monitoring, quality improvement and risk management.

Shape the organization’s use of data and insights to prioritize all organization analytics projects to align with operational planning.

Effectively use internal and external data repositories and analytical tools to understand NYGH’s performance overtime and relative to other hospitals and identify opportunities for operational and/or data quality improvements.

Provide ongoing advice and support for stakeholders who capture, process, and submit data which impacts funding, case costing and new program evaluation.

Delivery and relationship management

Build relationships and partnerships amongst multiple stakeholders within and beyond NYGH including front line staff and leaders across clinical programs, support services as well as with academic partners, provincial/national leaders, peer hospitals, government Ministries, provincial agencies such as Ontario Health and the relevant regional and local tables, , TAHSN, Ontario Hospital Association, local health and social service organizations, municipal and private sector partners.

Work closely with Chief Digital Officer, Chief Medical Information Officer and other leaders to:
1. Advance a community health learning approach at NYGH and to align organizational activity with strategy and operational planning.
2. To define business and technology systems requirements
3. Determine key products, services and technical architectures that support data in the organization
4. Advance implementation of an organizational data and analytics strategy

Provide support to Ontario Health Team’s Data and Analytics Working Groups.

Work closely with internal stakeholders and partners to shape the organization’s use of data and analytic tools to support performance monitoring, quality improvement and decision making.
Qualifications

Post-Secondary Degree, including Graduate level Degree in Health Administration, Business Administration, Data Science, Computer Science/Engineering, Informatics, or other relevant discipline required

Certification with the Canadian College of Health Leaders (CCHL) and/or Canadian College for Health Records Administrators (CCHRA) an asset

Minimum five (5-10) years’ experience managing large teams in a healthcare delivery organization

Substantial experience and understanding of health information management practices and requirements in a hospital environment

Extensive analytical skills and understanding of the interrelationship of key clinical, financial, and human resources information and working knowledge of relevant industry-specific external data sets and tools (e.g., DAD, NACRS, WTIS,
CIHI, DART, IDS, OHA)

Strong working knowledge of and insights into leading and emerging technologies in the information/data management and analytics

Demonstrated ability to lead a technical team, with a focus on modeling, Python, SQL, R, and machine learning/AI techniques

Deep experience in leading teams with a focus on HIM, Data and Analytics

Experience working directly with senior and medical leaders to support information and analysis required to inform strategy, organizational planning, manage performance, identify improvement opportunities, and make decisions

Experience planning and managing multiple, complex projects involving major changes to business processes, workflows, and the associated change management process

Experience with data quality improvement on large data sets and use of data integrity techniques

Demonstrated ability to manage large, diverse teams with high value, time sensitive deliverables and competing priorities, while leading major projects or change initiatives

Strong coaching and mentoring skills with proven track record of developing high performing teams and team leaders

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including delivering presentations with complex information to senior administrative and medical leadership

In-depth knowledge of business analytic frameworks, strategies, technologies, and processes to support strategic and operational planning and decision making

Excellent critical thinking and decision-making skills
What We Offer
Working at NYGH means working with a dynamic team of fellow healthcare providers, staff, and volunteers in one of Canada’s leading hospitals. This is a Full Time Regular Position with 8 hour shifts, Days shifts in the Decision Support Department. We offer a highly competitive total compensation package that includes benefits, pension, and vacation. If you were searching for more reasons to consider joining the wonderful team at NYGH, check out some features of our Total Rewards package by visiting nygh.on.ca

About Us
Copperstone helps mining companies manage liabilities and safety costs associated with their tailings ponds. We do this by building field robots that can access their tailing ponds in a way never before possible. Our robots bring sensors or sampling payloads to a tailings pond, keeping people out of harm’s way, reducing costs and improving efficiencies for our clients. Inspired by advanced remote sensing and space robotics, we envision developing innovative tools and exploratory methods to help Earth’s most challenging environments. Copperstone started operations in 2014 and has since grown a creative and committed team supporting the mining industry with robotic services for hazardous site investigations.
Why Copperstone?
We put people first
We think yes before no
We believe there is a solution, and we will find it
We always strive to do the right thing, especially when it is difficult
We think numbers matter: accuracy, action, and accountability
We believe that robots can enable humans to reach further, tread lighter, and stay safer by harnessing the potential that exists at the intersection of robotics, autonomous vehicles, artificial intelligence, the environment, and the industrial IOT.
The Role
Copperstone is seeking a Junior Software Developer to organize our data, build metrics and models to explain and diagnose the performance of our robots. This new member will be responsible for supporting the software team with their ad-hoc data analysis, development of dashboards and data pipelines. To do this, the candidate needs to be a motivated, enthusiastic team member with a commitment to quality, and success as a team. The ideal candidate is an effective team worker, who listens well, respects diversity of opinions and has an open, clear and succinct communication style. The candidate will be able to identify and assess technology development opportunities, initiate and manage multiple ongoing product development projects, and recognise and define problems by collecting data to draw relevant and valid conclusions. The candidate should be excited to push robots to their limits in the field.
Duties and Responsibilities
Use robot telemetry data to generate statistical models that identify and forecast valuable metrics
Develop interactive dashboards, invent new dynamic ways of looking at the data, get creative in order to drive system improvements and help draw meaningful insights and recommendations to end users
Deliver information required for client reporting
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in CS, Math, Physics, Engineering or equivalent real world experience
Basic knowledge in SQL
Strong ability to write and document clear Python code
Proficient with Unix/Linux and Python virtual environments
Self-starter with a positive and enthusiastic demeanor to thrive in the ambiguity of a dynamic, start-up environment
Work closely with a growing software team reporting to the software team lead with updating as needed
Ongoing, effective communication with the entire Copperstone team
Bonus Qualifications
Experience designing, training, and critically analyzing ML models for big data
Experience with building and maintaining distributed data pipelines
Experience with MapReduce frameworks (Hadoop, Spark, BigQuery)
Experience in computer vision and robotics
Experience with statistical analysis of ML model performance
Salary and Benefits
$55,000-$75,000/year depending on experience
Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, wellness program, long-term disability and life insurance
A creative environment with people driven to develop world-changing solutions
Open and flexible workspaces
Professional development opportunities, and more!

The Data Scientist will be a part of our Technology and Market Analysis team. This role will focus on developing and applying machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to support pricing models and other insights around carbon markets. They will work closely with other key internal stakeholders, to research data science models and oversee end-to-end implementation. The Data Scientist will lead research projects to solve the ongoing challenges while mentoring and supporting other team members.
Requirements of the Role
The Data Scientist will be responsible for but not limited to:
Define data science projects from start to finish, identifying opportunities, defining the problem, building a proof of concept, and deploying a data product to improve marketing, product development, or overall business strategies
Conduct data mining on customer, product, sales, assortment data sources for insights; generate hypotheses to test for opportunities
Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions and projects in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals.
Apply a wide range of statistical and quantitative analysis in practical and valuable ways
Design custom tools to optimize data mining, cleaning, validation and analysis tasks
Develop tools and testing models to ensure data accuracy
Use predictive modeling to optimize environmental financial unit pricing forecasts
Program and write maintainable and well-documented scripts/applications for process automation; produce reusable machine learning pipelines while model building
Connect with other teams to understand the go-to-market process, product lifecycle, and product/consumer strategy
Create rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources; communicate results to senior leadership
Propose solutions and strategies to business opportunities and challenges
So are you our next Data Scientist? You could be if you are a curious self-starter who is an insightful, results-orientated, and motivated professional with exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. You have a proven ability to conduct thorough analysis using multiple data sources, evaluate and present visual results in Tableau. The Data Scientist requires the ability to understand a concept from a broader perspective with strong problem-solving skills. You are adaptable and love working with people and teams from diverse skillsets and backgrounds, in a highly collaborative and often times remote working environment.
Experience, Education, and Designations:
Academic background in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Research, or a related field
Must have experience with Tableau and/or Python
Strong SQL and/or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Experience in at least one of the common data science toolkits
Demonstrated experience applying machine learning and data mining techniques
Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:
Strong problem solving and analytical skills including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization through Tableau
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including reports and presentations
Strong technical attitude – ability to turn business problems into analytical solution
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results
Ability to take on responsibilities and work with minimal supervision
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships
Communicates with kindness and has integrity
Ideally understands what carbon markets are and has passion for environmental issues

As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for:
Developing of analytics within well-defined projects to address customer needs and opportunities

Contributing to continuous improvement and quality initiatives as well as innovative approaches and solutions to business problems

Fuel your passion

Have completed a Degree in Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or other relevant discipline related to Data Science

Have knowledge and experience of current and emerging machine learning/AI techniques

Have exposure to Big Data and Cloud technologies (for algorithm development as well as for data storage and software engineering)

Job Title
Data Scientist
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
In this role as a Data Scientist, you will analyze, design, and implement data science/machine learning solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools. The group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. Leveraging leading-edge technologies and capabilities, the group applies machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made.
What will you do?
Work with business partners and stakeholders to understand the problem statement/business objective and accordingly develop machine learning algorithms to identify these complex threat scenarios that are able to evade traditional detection tools.
Prototype the algorithms for execution in the Hadoop environment, GPU and cloud environments.
Work with business stakeholders, internal and external QA to ensure that the final product is of the highest quality and is able to meet pre-defined business objects.
Collaborate with application development and data engineering team to deploy a scalable batch/real-time model to production.
Support the development of a proactive approach to threat detection and/or misuse identification.
Train and mentor junior employees when applicable.
Participate in Proof of Concept or Proof of Technology projects to evaluate cybersecurity technologies and platforms.
Operate third-party technologies to analyze security data and identify threats and misuse cases, and evaluate capabilities of those technologies.
Participate in the creation of detailed plans and accurate estimates towards the development, testing, and implementation of proactive threat detection capabilities.
Contribute to successful completion of projects by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:

About Us
Minpraxis Solutions focuses on transferring cutting-edge R&D into real solutions for mine developers and operators. As an award-winning Vancouver-based company we deliver transformative products and engineering to the minerals industry.
We are looking for a self-starting individual who is eager to apply their data science and signal processing skills to the development of an exciting new mining technology.
About the Role
This position is ideal for a data scientist who wants to be a part of a small and dynamic team. Working closely with the founding team, you will be working directly with the CEO, COO and a coder to help deliver a new and exciting product to the market.
If you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and wants to see the impact of their work, this is the position for you!
The role is full-time (40 hours a week) for a duration of up to 6 months (starting in early October, 2022 and ending at the end of March, 2023). The work will be mainly remote (ideally candidates are based in Vancouver) with some on-site (UBC Point Grey Campus) work.
JOB DESCRIPTION / WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
Your primary responsibility will be to assist with development of an innovative Minpraxis device. In particular, you will be:
Working as part of a small team to develop algorithms that allow for automation of signal processing challenges
Define and communicate developed algorithms for implementation into Minpraxis’ software (by a Minpraxis coder)
Setup data analysis frameworks and workflows
Analyze past data and develop predictive models
Develop 3D visualizations and summaries of provided spatial data
REQUIREMENTS
Highly proficient in data analysis, signal processing and algorithm building
Skilled at developing effective 3D representations of data
Well organized with good attention to detail
You work well within a team environment
Self-motivated, able to prioritize, and work with minimal guidance
English skills (ability to effectively communicate via written and spoken
English)
Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week
Essential Qualifications/Skills:
Degree/Major in Data Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related field
Working knowledge of data science languages such as SQL, PowerShell, R and/or Python
Extensive experience in artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques
Experience with data analysis and signal processing for algorithm building. Examples of skillsets include signal filtering, convolution, denoising, detrending, smoothing and downsampling/upsampling
Experience with algorithm building for automation of signal processing challenges
Experience with visual representation of spatial data in 3D
Highly competent with data analysis and predictive model development

Job Description
Manulife’s bold ambition is to become a digital, customer leader. As part of this ambition, we have made a significant investment in Advanced Analytics and AI capabilities. The goal of the Group Advanced Analytics & AI team is to research, build, and deliver cutting edge capabilities to better support our external customers as well as provide actionable insights to our internal corporate stakeholders.
NLP Centre of Excellence (CoE) is a part of advance analytics team at Manulife which specializes in development of machine learning and deep learning applications on variety of unstructured dataset, such as topic modeling using voice call transcripts, using a two-tower transformer model to do a semantic search in historical documents, using weak supervised learning to classify surveys, etc.
NLP CoE in Manulife is looking for a data scientist at an associate or mid senior level. This data scientist will play a key role in achieving this ambitious mission of the team. The successful candidate will have strong background in NLP and deep learning at academic or industry level, good communication skills, innovative mindset, and strong strategic and functional skills.
We are looking for someone with:
Master’s or Ph.D. in a quantitative discipline (Business Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, etc.).
1-3 years of experience in developing probabilistic models, deep learning and/or machine learning algorithms in the area of natural language processing.
Proficiency in languages used for querying, data processing, statistical analysis, model building, and monitoring, including Python and SQL.
Strong understanding of the foundation of machine learning algorithms, statistical methods, and natural language processing methods.
Comfort with visual art and design to turn statistical and computational analysis into user-friendly graphs, charts, and animations. Create insightful data visualizations (e.g., motion charts, word maps) that highlight trends.
Passionate about continuously learning in the ever-evolving ML domain and exploring new methodologies to solve business problems.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Strong collaboration and elaboration skills; demonstrates a strong commitment to organizational success; shares resources and leverages knowledge across the organization.
Adaptable and open to change
Individual Accountabilities:
Consult with internal business leaders and bring analytics driven insights to solve business challenges
Develop and implement analytics enabled solutions to improve customer experience, drive customer engagement, and increase customer value.
Review and analyze existing processes to identify customer opportunities. Work with large amounts of call center, web and other data sources to build holistic view of customer journey
Innovate and find creative ways to source customer data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data using Big Data technologies and NLP
Calculate model impact/return on investment and communicate value analysis to partners
Peer review other Data Scientists’ work and participate in model and code reviews
What can we offer you?
A competitive salary and benefits packages.
A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills.
A focus on growing your career path with us.
Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.
Professional development and leadership opportunities.

Values-first culture - We lead with our Values every day and bring them to life together.
Boundless opportunity - We create opportunities to learn and grow at every stage of your career.
Continuous innovation - We invite you to help redefine the future of financial services.

Who We Are
Fasken is a leading international business law and litigation firm. Our firm’s 800 lawyers are located across offices in Vancouver, Surrey, Calgary, Toronto, Ottawa, Montréal, Québec City, London and Johannesburg. Providing strategic and thoughtful advice in all areas of business law, our broad range of clients include close to half of the Fortune 100 companies, as well as corporate clients, government agencies, regulatory authorities, non-profit bodies and individuals. Our clients interests are paramount in all that we do and we take pride in supporting our communities. We are a place where bright, talented, and collegial people want to work together and we work hard together to achieve our goals in a collaborative and efficient way.
A Day In The Life
Reporting to the Manager, Operational Reporting, the Data Analyst will support the data governance and analytics solutions to support the Firm’s strategic decision making process. The successful candidate will be a data-driven individual who possesses analytical problem solving, data manipulation, and data management skills.
Hours of work are from 10 am to 6 pm PST. Occasional pre-authorized overtime may be required to meet client needs. The role is remote-first, with the occasional on-site meeting at the Vancouver office in order to collaborate with team members and business stakeholders. The Analytics team is located across several offices, therefore the candidate should be comfortable collaborating in a remote-first fashion.
Primary Responsibilities
Master Data Maintenance:
Process recurring and adhoc updates of various business fields in the ERP system
Perform reconciliations and quality assurance verifications before and after changes to ensure that all updates have been properly processed
Respond to Master Data change requests and questions from internal stakeholders (Tickets)

Data Governance:
Perform data quality review exercises to ensure the quality of data is consistent (ie. Missing fields, Improper Fields)
In collaboration with our Data Engineer, the Data Analyst will participate in various initiatives such as setting up and monitoring data pipelines, transformations, etc.
Participate in Special Projects on ad hoc basis
Monitor Data Quality in the ERP, and develop tools to measure

Development & Analytics
The Data Analysts will maintain or enhance existing quality monitoring reports/queries and dashboards, as well as develop new ones
Perform and process internal information requests (ie. Audit Requests, Reports, etc.)
Other Ad hoc requests and special projects
Must Haves
Bachelor’s degree in math, statistics, engineering, computer science, or other quantitative field, or equivalent level of experience
Minimum 1 - 3 years of experience in data analysis, data science, data engineering, business intelligence, database administration, or other related field
Intermediate Transact-SQL skills, including writing and running SQL Quer
Basic knowledge of SQL Data Structure (Database, Tables, etc.)
Some working experience with with PowerBI and SSRS knowledge is an asset
Strong technical skills with Microsoft 365 applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams).
Why Work With Us
Fasken is dedicated to rewarding your contributions and encouraging your professional development. We offer a comprehensive salary and benefits package that is very competitive, together with opportunities for personal and professional growth. Our benefits include:
A health and wellness subsidy
An annual education & tuition reimbursement

Personal days
Employee & family assistance program

Job Title: Machine Learning Scientist and Software Developer
Job Description:
Title:
Machine Learning Scientist and Software Developer
Description:
We are looking for a software-oriented scientist or science-oriented software developer who wants to get a wide range of experience, and loves learning about physics, materials, chemistry, polymers, and electronics through a hands-on approach. This individual should:
Thrive working in a small, fast-paced team, leading the machine learning and software projects on the team, and making substantial contributions to the success of their projects
Be a generalist who can quickly learn and is willing and able to dive deep when necessary, specializing in specific topics as required
Be able to take a step back and manage a wide variety of tasks across different disciplines
Be good at collaborating with research scientists, engineers and specialists across different disciplines to drive cross-functional project development
Be a competent software developer who can maintain an existing (documented!) repository
Have a strong familiarity both with deep learning pipelines and software simulation of physical systems
Be comfortable working through problems and figuring things out with minimal supervision
Have familiarity with molecular structures, general chemistry, and basic physics
At Halion you will play an integral role in R&D and product development, ranging from material discovery to developing tools from physics simulations to project management applications.
We're a startup, so we're pretty relaxed about working hours, dress code, etc. We have heard that some candidates think "this sounds like a great place to work but there's no way I'm qualified..." - we are looking for good people, not just good experience! If your skills roughly align with what we've listed below, and you like the cut of our jib, give it a shot.
Perks
Employee benefits program (dental, vision, etc.)
Free coffee!
Flexible work hours
Control over your own project with a large impact on the final product
Responsibilities:
Maintaining and extending an existing code repository
Developing a deep learning pipeline using an existing project as a starting point, using cloud resources as well as on-site resources with the aim of improving the performance, accuracy and efficiency of quantum chemistry calculations and their application in advanced materials science
Developing code to work with existing datasets, and to create and work with new custom datasets
Interfacing with scientists and engineers to determine and satisfy project requirements
Design experiments; collect, analyze and interpret data; drive technical problem solving
Responsibly handling and working with sensitive and confidential information
Developing and running physics simulations using a variety of tools
Prototyping various software tools for other teams in the company to use
Programming microcontrollers to interface with prototypes as well as other electronic devices in order to meet technical specifications
Deep dive into literature to test, validate, and improve existing procedures and to develop new ones
Write research papers, abstracts, technical reports and SOPs
Effectively communicate project updates, difficulties and plans to team members
Train co-op students, contractors or other personnel; may supervise interns
Minimum qualifications:
BS or BASc in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, Computational Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, related field, or equivalent practical experience
Able to legally work in Canada
Competent Python developer - expert level not required, knowledge of algorithms not required, but you will be asked to code a few simple Python programs in an interview setting, and you may be asked to do a take-home development assignment
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills are required
Assets:
Ability to manage multiple complex projects and changing priorities, make sound decisions under pressure, and work effectively in a team environment
Ability to rapidly learn new systems and procedures
Experience working on challenging projects in a research environment. Ability to learn from failure and move on quickly to new strategies
Experience with Unix/Linux and HPC environments
Experience working with virtual environments, especially conda/miniconda
2+ years of professional experience building and deploying deep learning solutions
Experience with various machine learning frameworks, i.e. Tensorflow or Pytorch
Knowledge of Python is a requirement, other languages are a bonus
A link to your personal public git repository, or your open source contributions
Personal projects of any flavour: software, hardware, humanities, etc.
Experience with active, continuous, or transfer learning
Basic knowledge of chemistry, organic chemistry, electrostatics, and the physics of materials and molecules
Organization skills and the ability to use project management tools
Familiarity with standard operations and concepts within linear algebra
Good ability to visualize and manipulate 3D objects in your mind
Ability to travel internationally up to 6 weeks/yr.
Experience with electronics projects
Instructions to apply:
Do you want to be the very best [candidate], like no-one ever was? If so, please demonstrate the following in your cover letter and resume:
You have a bias for action (but you think before you act).
You enjoy working on personal projects not related to work (but you know how to manage your priorities).
You like technology - past, present and future.
You love learning new things, do so quickly, and can easily connect concepts from different fields.
You will use the word juxtaposition as naturally as possible in your application, so I know that you read this.
You like to solve problems, especially using your creativity and imagination.
You thrive in ambiguous environments that enable you to be creative.
Failure does not deter you from trying harder but you also know when to give up.
You derive your self worth from the effort you put in, and not from your successes or failures.
You are constantly working to experiment and improve yourself, because nobody is perfect.
An enjoyment of Star Wars is an asset. Bonus points if you can make a good Wookiee sound.
Our interview process will include up to 1 phone screen, 3 interviews, a short take-home assignment, and reference checks where applicable.

WealthCo is looking for a Data Analyst to join our amazing team based in Calgary, Alberta.This position offers competitive benefits, opportunities for advancement and the advantages of growing and learning alongside accomplished business leaders in the Wealth Management industry. The opportunity to utilize innovative technology and receive ongoing education are a few of the benefits of this role.
An entrepreneurial and innovative spirit are highly valued at WealthCo and align to our core values. Team members are encouraged to work within their unique ability. By doing what we are passionate about daily, we become more productive, engaged, and successful.
The Analyst is responsible for data integrity across our integrated asset management firm. With a keen attention to detail and an appreciation of how important accurate reporting is for our client’s, the Analyst will provide proactive technical and reporting support to ensure the delivery an exceptional client support and service, accomplished by prioritizing accuracy, timeliness, and responsiveness. Systems such as Azure, Power BI Service, and CRM Dynamics will be supported by this role. The Analyst supports the WealthCo Team in achieving business objectives and goals reporting directly to the COO.
You will support the company’s goals and objectives by:
Building analytics and reporting to support sales activity while providing recommendations to improve the sales process.
Collaborating with leadership teams to create data strategies that support data modeling.
Leveraging investigative and problem-solving skill to rectify issues to ensure ongoing data integrity.
Increases effectiveness and efficiency within the firm by enhancing and ensuring ongoing data integrity.
Supports and develops corporate cloud infrastructure in Azure.
Manages data documentation as it pertains to our pools and their sub-holdings.
Responsible for the ongoing communication and issue resolution with our data solution providers
Responsibility for projects as they pertain to our data and reporting systems.
Build strong and influential internal relationships to help ensure business objectives are being met.
Successful candidates will require:
University degree or certificate in the following disciplines: Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Data Science.
3-5 years data management experience.
Proven experience in creation of dashboards, data visualization and reporting, as well as managing data ceremonies, data cleaning and preparation.
Experience with Azure Data Services as ADF, ADL Gen2, Azure Automations.
Experience with Power platform (Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, Power Queries in M code, Power Query dataflows)
Experience with CRM Dynamics 365
WealthCo’s mission is to change the financial services industry. By leveraging the unique relationship between an accountant and their client, we are able to help better serve them through our Integrated Advisory model. WealthCo serves our clients through Wealth Planning, Risk Management, Asset Management, Group Benefits, and Integrated Advisory across Western Canada.
WealthCo offers competitive salaries based on education and experience, incentive compensation, continuous education, opportunities for advancement and excellent benefits with include RRSP matching.
While we thank everyone for their interest, we are only able to contact applicants selected for an interview. You are encouraged to watch for future opportunities by checking www.wealthco.ca.

Job Title: (CAN) Analyst, Business Systems and Analytics – Direct Store Delivery (12 month contract)
Job Description:
Job Type: Temporary (Fixed Term)
Schedule: Morning, afternoons, evenings, nights
Position Summary...
The Analyst, Business Systems and Analytics – Direct Store Delivery will report to the Manager, Direct Store Delivery and will work closely with a team of Analysts to provide ongoing data support for the DOME Project. After the launch of DOME, this role will be responsible for assisting with the ongoing enhancements and maintenance of the system. This role builds out the entire tableau portfolio for the DSD program and will also provide analytics to the Walmart freight program and tie reporting, analysis, and results to the original objects.
What you'll do...
1. Project Management: work with competing priorities and tight deadlines, while overseeing a long-term project timeline and hitting milestones. Focus on the day-to-day task such as data cleansing, verifying, and user testing.
2. Schedule/systems/database/tool development: support with the development process of Project DOME, reflecting user needs in the product and responsible for future enhancements. Once the model is completed, the Analyst will support with ongoing maintenance and enhancements to the code.
3. Data analytics: extract reliable data from various data sources, including the Scheduler, WTMS, Helios, and CDL, to support Project DOME and help the business identify pain points. Individual will also be responsible for the build and maintenance of all the tableau reporting and business analytics that get shared with cross-functional business stakeholders. Responsible for producing analytics to optimize scheduling between stores and DSD suppliers. Analyst will be required to consolidate data and taking into consideration project parameters (zoning, municipality restriction bylaws).
4. Data science: proficient in data mining, data engineering, coding (including, but not limited to, Python, Hadoop, SQL, VBA, R, Excel). Pulling data from shared data warehouses, LSS database, Helios, FourKites.
5. Technical communications: work with technical and non-technical teams and communicate complex topics in a simple, concise manner to both audiences. Take data and articulate it into tableaus for use by business leaders, suppliers, internal stakeholders (merchants, SC, Replenishment, store operations).
6. Business judgement: provide adhoc analyses for business partners to establish and align on realistic expectations.
7. Design thinking: create innovative business solutions that address business needs with a seamless user experience that works today and tomorrow.

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

The Data Scientist will join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics team within Data & Technology that applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable business-first solutions for sustainable growth at OMERS. The Data Scientist will work alongside analytics specialists on their team and partner with data and analytics specialists within businesses and corporate functions to design, develop, implement and scale advanced solutions following best practices to drive measurable business outcomes.

Reporting to the Director of Enterprise Data Science, you will work closely with our Businesses, Corporate Functions, Enterprise Architecture, Business Relationship Management, Infrastructure and Enterprise Service Management, Cyber, Data Engineering, Data Governance and Analytics Strategy teams to deploy new capabilities following leading product management and AI system methodologies. You will develop and nurture strong relationships with partners in a variety of different business units across our global portfolio, building an understanding of their needs and how to apply data, analytics and AI techniques to increase scale and operational efficiency, enhance self-service capabilities and elevate the understanding & application of these capabilities across the company.

The Data Scientist will partner with internal stakeholders and external partners to build out AI systems and deliver data analytics projects within set timelines. They meet objectives and focus on priorities which drive the successful operation of this Department and ensures alignment with OMERS business and technology strategy.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Fostering strong relationships among cross-functional teams and facilitating decision making within multi-level audiences. Applying a system thinking approach to lead execution of data, analytics and AI initiatives quickly and in collaboration with other teams
Driving the implementation of corporate/strategic objectives via AI/ML driven projects and seeing opportunities
Building ML projects from experiments and hands-on solutioning through to production
Implementing model tracking, updating, and auto-train capabilities in addition to accounting for drift and imbalance
Building and maintaining NLP models using state of the art techniques like transformers and seq2seq for the purposes of classification, sentiment analysis, entity extraction, and more
Driving analytics innovation by posing open ended questions, exploring new ideas, recommending the appropriate techniques to solve challenging business problems and rapid prototyping
Developing, deploying, and operationalizing data science products along with the supporting integrated tools and processes, including but not limited to security, performance, scalability, and extendibility
Hands on creation and oversight of analytical models, conducting model training, validation, testing, integrated reconciliations and ongoing data and model integrity maintenance
Remaining on the “leading edge” of emerging data, analytics and AI technologies and techniques to identify and implement novel tools and techniques and their application to new use cases and deployment opportunities
Driving a culture of innovation and AI by taking initiatives for activities such as lunch and learns, hackathons, paper readouts, etc.

To succeed in this role, you have:
A undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or any other quantitative field
Minimum five (5) years’ experience working in a data science/ Machine Learning environment
1-3+ years of experience leading and delivering enterprise-scale data science/ML projects and facilitating collaboration across teams
A proven grasp of the practical and theoretical aspects of statistical and deep learning such as data structures, algorithms, gradient descent, probability theory, linear algebra, calculus, hypothesis testing, and more
Experience building scalable and automated ML pipelines with strong Python programming skills
Natural language computing/understanding experience including but not limited to source data extraction, structuring, named entity extraction, sentiment analysis, topic modelling, and more
Experience with framework such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, MxNet and the sci-kit learn library
Proficiency with git is a must
Experience implementing pre-built models at scale along with retraining and implementing a custom deep-learning architecture is a strong plus
Experience working in the financial sector- ideally banks or investment firms, is an asset
Experience within Pensions, Investments and Commercial Real Estate sectors are an asset
Hands-on experience with big data systems such as Spark, Hadoop, Hive and ideally cloud technologies such as Azure Data Factory, AzureML, Azure Synapse, Google Fusion, Google BigQuery, AWS SageMaker, and others
Experience in using external/alternative data, data modeling, data architecture, data engineering, insight generation, data visualization, feature engineering and AI systems development & optimization
A passion around learning new technologies and analytical techniques with a track record of acting on this in prior roles and in their free time through projects, partnerships, mentoring and hackathons
Demonstrated experience as a leader in creatively addressing unique or ambiguous situations and motivating teams and delivering multiple projects simultaneously serving multiple stakeholders
The ability to build relationships and facilitate across a diverse group of stakeholders in several different business units
Demonstrated experience applying product management, design thinking and human centered design
Polished written and verbal communication and presentation skills targeted at all levels of the organization

Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Job Description :
About Us

Amica Senior Lifestyles is setting a new standard for senior living in Canada by combining unparalleled premium hospitality and amenities with expert care and support to deliver a personalized senior living experience. Committed to enriching the lives of seniors now and as their needs change, Amica offers Independent Living (IL), Assisted Living (AL) and Memory Care (MC) lifestyle options. Established in 1996, the company owns and operates 33 residences in British Columbia, Alberta and Ontario, with plans to continue expansion in select markets.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Director, Research & Development Analytics, we are looking for an individual who is passionate about applying machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to support our investment strategy at Amica Senior Lifestyles. This individual will be working closely with cross-functional partners to research data science models and oversee end-to-end implementation of the models into production systems. Working with teams of diverse skillsets and backgrounds, lead research projects to solve the most difficult and convoluted problems an investment team has while taking additional responsibility of mentoring junior team members. With the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Data & Analytics, to continued growth and development with Amica Senior Lifestyles.

What you will be doing
Build and execute a long-term roadmap of elevating data science capabilities within Amica by researching, piloting, and introducing leading edge data technologies and products
Effectively plan and manage analytics projects, leading small technical teams
Define data science projects end to end including identifying opportunities, defining the problem, building proof of concepts, and deploying solutions to production
Conduct data mining, on assorted data sources, to extract insights and generate hypotheses for model development & testing
Perform data pre-processing, data integrity, feature selection, model selection analysis and identify opportunities to improve existing data models and techniques
Develop machine learning models and support the management of models throughout the model lifecycle, produce reusable machine learning pipelines while building models
Gain and maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and acquire ability to effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes
Guide and mentor data analysts in improving data quality and availability; help them create rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis
Balance multiple, competing priorities effectively, track documentation and deliverables in an organized manner
Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals

What you will bring

Master’s degree or PhD/Research, ideally in a discipline such as
Business Analytics / Business Intelligence
Computer Science,
Statistics,
Applied Science/ Engineering,
or related area
An understanding of data-driven technology with 5+ years’ experience in data and analytics environments
Solid experience working with complex datasets and building research-based data models
Strong foundation in supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning techniques, Feature Engineering, Classification, Clustering, Segmentation, NLP, Time Series Analysis and Demand Forecasting etc.
Knowledge of and experience with relational databases (SQL, PostgreSQL etc.)
Strong scripting and programming skills in Python /R
Excellent communication and presentation skills with fluency in translating business questions into actionable requirements
Proven team-management experience strongly preferred
Advanced MS Office user, ability to create powerful presentations and write high-quality executive reports
Quick learner, ability to work well in a team, and strong problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail and an ability to multi-task on simultaneous projects under tight deadlines

What you can expect from us

A diverse and inclusive environment where individual differences are celebrated, and you’re encouraged to be your best self
A collaborative environment where we work together to succeed as a team
Learning opportunities to help you grow and support for professional development and designations
Comprehensive benefit package including RRSP matching
Office is centrally located in the financial district, on the PATH and the TTC subway line, and provides easy access to downtown amenities
Participation in Amica’s Flex or Hybrid work model providing team members the opportunity to work a combination of days both in office and remotely

At Amica Senior Lifestyles we are passionate about working together in a supportive and inclusive environment that fosters innovation and turns ideas into action. We remain committed to creating workplaces that reflect the communities in which we operate. We are actively seeking applicants from all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, Black, Indigenous, racialized people, and persons with disabilities and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for our positions.

Amica Senior Lifestyles recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, team members and visitors from COVID-19. Effective October 2021, a condition of employment is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.
Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Job Title: Machine Learning Research Scientist - Biotechnology Company

This is a leading company in artificial intelligence for drug discovery that has launched multiple software products, including target identification platform, and automated drug discovery platform. We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join the team. You will work with product teams as well as top AI scientists in this field. We focus on AI-assisted systems that can identify novel drug targets for untreated diseases, assist in the development of new treatments and eventually predict how well those treatments may perform in clinical trials. This company was ranked Top 5 AI companies in its potential for social impact according to NVIDIA and in 2018, the company was named one of the global top 100 AI companies by CB Insights. They are growing their team in Canada and are looking for people who want to be part of this journey.

Our Pharma.AI platform has the potential to rapidly bring novel breakthrough medicines to patients while decreasing costs and increasing the probability of success.

Our client is a data-driven company for application in the algorithmic trading industry. They’re seeking a highly academic and cerebral Data Scientist to join their Vancouver based office. Developing and bringing research and other projects to completion for use in an existing trading strategy

Work with or build machine learning models as a tool to inform research directions

Highly analytical, keen attention to detail
Innate curiosity and an exceptional critical thinker who is results-oriented

Thrive in a performance-based environment
Require excellence of yourself and in the work you produce

Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Montreal, Quebec, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Calgary, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA

Jobs by Category: Technology Solutions
Job Function: Data Science
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Join our team

Our Reliability Centre of Excellence team ensures that Reliability by Design is embedded within our network and services architecture and operations while maintaining a reliability-focused culture across TELUS.
Transparently, the environment is fast paced, intense, and demanding. There are no proven solutions to leverage, a steep learning curve, and continuous expectations from executive leadership to drive value for customers. On the other hand, you will be working on a project that has C-suite visibility, an opportunity to redefine technology possibilities and capabilities, and transform the customer experience at TELUS.
Here's the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As a Data Scientist, you will be at the front end, systematically analyzing and transforming vast amounts of unstructured data into actionable insights that are impactful in many ways. The expectation is to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen our data driven decision-making culture, improve the customer experience, increase revenue, reduce operating costs, and drive growth.
How do you know this is the right challenge for you? Quite simply, you are known as someone who:
has a history of driving insights that have a profound impact on the business or customers
is resilient and can lead others through high pressure, ambiguous and challenging environments
has the “know how” in leveraging rigorous and structured approach to solve complex problems


Here's How

Intrinsically, you are:
Entrepreneurial: embrace the art of the possible and take initiative in driving change
Strong communicator: tell the story and get to the point in a clear and concise manner
Curious and inquisitive: are passionate about learning and continuously drill down into a problem to uncover the root cause
Courageous: are prepared to go to a place of discomfort and thrive in ambiguity
Inclusive: collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and individuals with diverse backgrounds, and value different perspectives
Technology advocate: leverage tools and capabilities to drive insights and efficiencies
Action oriented: turn strategic visions into solution designs and execution plans
Customer-centric: always look through the lens of the customer
Additional factors that make you a great member to our team

5+ years of experience in evaluating and applying statistical and predictive models (i.e. SPSS) including constructing algorithms, regressions, and clustering
Advanced proficiency in database querying, data extraction frameworks, data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence and relational database design
