Qohash is a cybersecurity start-up that provides solutions to detect, track and protect the sensitive data of any organization, from small and medium-sized enterprises to large financial institutions, in the public and private sectors. Qohash is headquartered in Quebec city, with around 50 employees, all working remotely from Canada and the United States.
The mission of Qohash answers a growing demand for personal data protection. New national and international regulations, such as GDPR in the European Union, PIPEDA in Canada or CCPA in California, require all types of public and private organizations to protect the personal data of their customers, so as to prevent any breach that could affect millions of people. To meet this growing demand for data security, Qohash offers hybrid SAAS and on-premises solutions allowing the detection of all sensitive data within an organization, and its real-time tracing in order to guarantee its integrity and reduce the risk of loss or theft.
Qohash has signed contracts with some of the largest financial institutions in Canada, and is also launched on the American market. In addition, we are heading towards a Series B financing round which would lead the company to double its workforce in the near future. It is in this dynamic, extremely fast-growing environment that we are looking for a data science intern and machine learning, for a period of up to 4 months.
What you will do
As an intern, your mission will be to help with the company's machine learning/data science projects. You will join the R&D team, which translates scientific concepts into practical methods, and works closely with the various engineering teams, which integrate these methods into the customer solutions.
Note that we are offering two different internship positions:
One for a student with a major in ML/Data science,
One for a student with a major in Software Engineering (and hopefully an interest in ML/Data Science).
Student Eligibility Assessment: we can only accept students who are currently enrolled in a Canadian post-secondary institution program and are a Canadian Citizen, a permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.
Who you are
The skills you need for the ML/Data Science internship:
Experience with Python
Experience with data science & machine learning libraries (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, tensorflow, etc.)
Ability to autonomously code machine learning algorithms (classification, regression, clustering, outlier detection, etc.)
Excellent understanding of deep learning models (CNN, RNN, embeddings, etc.)
Good knowledge of mathematics (optimization, graph theory, statistics, etc.).
Ability to explore the scientific literature in order to draw the essence of a given problem and to deduce the appropriate solutions.
Open-minded about the techniques to use to solve a given problem (possibly outside the scope of ML).
Experience with Git.
We do not require prior cybersecurity knowledge. These can be acquired as the internship progresses.
Working at Qohash means
Work with driven and smart colleagues
Operate in a truly collaborative environment with no ego
Be open and honest with feedbacks and opinions at all levels
Have a flexible schedule and vacation
Location: 100% remote

Company Description

Suffering from climate anxiety? So are we.

That's why we developed EcoRail, a software solution for reducing GHG emissions in the rail industry. EcoRail provides crews with real-time driving recommendations to operate their train in the most efficient way possible. Like Tesla did for cars, we strive to do for trains with user-friendly AI technology as we drive the rail industry towards being a fully autonomous system.

RailVision Analytics is a venture-backed start-up at a seed stage with numerous clients, including VIA Rail and Metrolinx. As we continue to grow our client-base, we are looking to expand our team with enthusiastic, forward-thinking people who want to have a positive impact on the environment through innovation.

If you're looking for a meaningful career, love the fast-paced culture of a start-up, and thrive on the flexibility of WFH (with the opportunity to travel for our destination quarterly meetings), then you've come to the right place. Apply and join our RailVision team today!

Why Work With Us?

Awesome WFH policy with quarterly in-person meetings around the world
Competitive salaries for quick-learners and fast-paced individuals
You will have the ability to gain career experience beyond strict job requirements, with decision-making power to be the master of your own projects
Resources for self-improvement including courses, software, workshops, and conferences
We are committed to hiring great people from diverse backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger

Job Description Overview

The role of a Data Scientist is to ensure the successful development and deployment of ML/Optimization models that can provide safe recommendations for train conductors, making the train operation more efficient and reducing carbon emissions. The Data Scientist will also build the infrastructure to enable future Autonomous Train Operations (ATO). We are looking for a driven, intellectual, and passionate individual with industry experience ready to play a significant role in the company's growth.

Main Responsibilities
Architect and develop end-to-end Machine Learning/Optimization models, working collaboratively with the Data Science team to optimize train operations in real-world settings.
Lead research effort into improving and enhancing train efficiency models.
Support the development of our train simulator, ensuring its accuracy and a seamless connection with the models and products.
Collaborate with the software development team to integrate ML/RL solutions into RailVision’s products.

Basic Qualifications
2+ years of relevant work experience.
Degree in an analytical field of study (e.g. Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other relevant fields).
Hands-on experience developing and deploying ML models, data pipelines, and running experiments to validate your models.
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine learning, clustering and classification techniques, and common CS algorithms.
Strong working knowledge of statistical techniques (distributions, regressions, error bounds, etc.)
Proficient in Python (i.e. Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, etc.) or other data science-related tools and libraries.

Desired Qualifications
Advanced degree in a quantitative field (preferably related to ML/Optimization or Transportation).
Deep understanding or experience with Reinforcement Learning models.
Knowledge or experience in physical simulation systems.
Proficiency with large datasets and time series (SQL, InfluxDB, etc.)
Experience with Python Machine Learning modules such as Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch.
Knowledge/experience with cloud computing platforms (preferably AWS).
Working experience with some or all the following: Containerization, associated build and deployment CI/CD pipelines
Working experience on a multifunctional agile software development team.
(Bonus) Experience in the rail industry.
Who We Look For
Creative individuals with the confidence to be a leader and the collaborative nature of a team member
Driven, self-motivated, and detail-focused individuals
Clear and concise communicators
Passion for career growth and continuous learning
Organized in work habits, schedules, timelines, documentation and correspondence
Other Details
Remote work with quarterly in-person meetings (location is voted on every quarter)
Incentives offered such as Employee Stock Options and yearly bonuses

Overview
If you want to work on a bold new business venture that could benefit millions of people and usher in a new era of healthcare, this could be the role for you.

Molecular You is a health-tech start-up on a mission to help people live longer, healthier lives. We give individuals unparalleled insight into their health and help them avoid chronic disease while also helping organizations understand disease and disease progression differently.

We use a unique blood test and machine learning to identify early warning signs of chronic diseases and give users simple but targeted recommendations to avert disease progression.

We are looking for a junior data analyst to help us uncover insights from our biological data and help us design and run machine learning experiments to develop new models that can predict disease.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will:
Collaborate with scientists to perform data analysis and experimentation on datasets acquired from databases and data warehouses
Use tools to transform data and visualize under the direction of the Science team
Work with our Data Science team to lay the foundation for AI & ML model building, release, management and visualization
Work cross-functionally with Data Science, Engineering, Operations and Product teams

Qualifications:
A graduate degree (PhD or MSc) in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Immunology, Biochemistry, or a related field
Experience in the Life Sciences, Systems Biology, Biochemistry, Biophysics, Cell Biology, Epidemiology, or Molecular Biology preferred
A solid foundation in statistical analysis
Excellent programming skills (Python preferred)
Experience working with high-throughput multi-omics biological data (eg. genomics, proteomics, metabolomics, etc)
Experience with multi-omic data integration and/or metabolic modeling/engineering is an asset
Excellent skills in data visualization and presentation of key findings
Driven to learn and master new techniques
Excellent documentation and organizational skills, with impeccable attention to detail
An understanding of basic machine learning would be desired
Experience with big-data technologies like Big Query/Snowflake/Redshift, Kafka, Airflow/other is an asset

Lydia AI (formerly Knowtions Research) is an applied AI company on a mission to insure the next billion people. Join us to help insure the next billion people!
Who we’re looking for
You are an individual with outstanding analytical abilities, firm understanding of machine learning and creativity to take new approaches in the way they solve problems. - Creative in finding new solutions as well as designing innovative methods, systems, and processes.
- Broad understanding of health data is an asset.

- Good interpersonal and communication skills.

Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Apply the principles of artificial intelligence, database systems, human/computer interaction, numerical analysis, and software engineering.

Connect with stakeholders to gain a full understanding of the problems they’re looking to solve.
Find analytical solutions to abstract business issues.
Apply objective analysis of facts before coming to a conclusion.
Look beyond what’s on the surface to discover patterns and solutions within the data.
Communicate across a diverse audience across all levels of an organization.

Python expert and Machine Learning specialist with skills in data-Analysis and working with various python libraries
Working knowledge of relational data modelling, with experience in SQL server and query development

Numerical skills used in a data science context, including working with numerical data in analytics and/or machine learning contexts
Easy-going personality. You will actively participate in project discussions, GUI development, and code review
Make modifications and fix bugs in existing Python code
Ongoing support of applications in response to changing business and system requirements
Strong multitasking, troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills;
Experience with development of custom GUIs (Graphic User Interfaces); such as standard Python GUI library Tkinter

Innoplexus is a leading global AI-based company for drug discovery and development with over 350 employees and 150+ patent applications including 42 grants in artificial intelligence, machine learning and blockchain technologies. Innoplexus’ solutions can generate real-time insights from hundreds of terabytes of structured and unstructured private and public data, thereby facilitating continuous, informed decision-making for its customer base at an unprecedented speed. Company Description

Suffering from climate anxiety? So are we.

That's why we developed EcoRail, a software solution for reducing GHG emissions in the rail industry. EcoRail provides crews with real-time driving recommendations to operate their train in the most efficient way possible. Like Tesla did for cars, we strive to do for trains with user-friendly AI technology as we drive the rail industry towards being a fully autonomous system.

RailVision Analytics is a venture-backed start-up at a seed stage with numerous clients, including VIA Rail and Metrolinx. As we continue to grow our client base, we are looking to expand our team with enthusiastic, forward-thinking people who want to have a positive impact on the environment through innovation.

If you're looking for a meaningful career, love the fast-paced culture of a start-up, and thrive on the flexibility of WFH (with the opportunity to travel for our destination quarterly meetings), then you've come to the right place. Apply and join our RailVision team today!

Why Work With Us?

You will have the ability to gain career experience beyond strict job requirements, with decision-making power to be the master of your own projects
Resources for self-improvement including courses, software, workshops, and conferences
We are committed to hiring great people from diverse backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger

Job Description Overview

The role of a Data Scientist - Simulator is to ensure the successful development and deployment of our Train Simulator, which models the dynamics of trains and their interaction with the environment. The simulator must be accurate and flexible to represent different applications (cargo, passengers) and different customers. Our simulator supports the development of ML learning models and contributes to the decisions that enable safer and more efficient operations. We are looking for a driven, intellectual, and passionate individual with industry experience ready to play a significant role in the company's growth.

Main Responsibilities
Design, develop new features, and maintain a train simulator that produces accurate results to support the development of ML models by our Data Science team.

Collaborate with the software development team to integrate the simulator into RailVision’s products.
Develop methodologies to calibrate and monitor the accuracy of the simulator.
Be an ambassador of technological advancement and revolutionized transportation.
Basic Qualifications
1-2 years of relevant work experience.
Degree in an analytical field of study (e.g. Engineering, Physics, Computer Science or other relevant fields).
Hands-on experience developing complex physical simulation systems.
Deep understanding of computational physics and the mechanics/dynamics of transportation systems.
Strong working knowledge of statistical techniques (distributions, regressions, error bounds, etc.)
Proficient in Python, bonus if other OOP languages (C++, Cython).
Desired Qualifications
Advanced degree in a quantitative field (preferably related to Simulation or Transportation).
In-depth understanding of the principles of train dynamics, operations and performance optimization.
Experience in quantitative computing or data science, preferably in ML.
Proficiency with large datasets and time series (SQL, InfluxDB, etc.)
Knowledge/experience with cloud computing platforms (preferably AWS).
Working experience on a multifunctional agile software development team.
Who We Look For
Creative individuals with the confidence to be a leader and the collaborative nature of a team member
Driven, self-motivated, and detail-focused individuals
Clear and concise communicators
Passion for career growth and continuous learning
Organized in work habits, schedules, timelines, documentation and correspondence
Other Details
Remote work with quarterly in-person meetings (location is voted on every quarter)
Incentives offered such as Employee Stock Options and yearly bonuses
RailVision Analytics is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If you require accommodation because of a disability or special need for any part of the employment process, please let us know on the job application form how we can help ensure you have a comfortable and positive experience.

Who we are and what we do
Mappedin powers search and discovery indoors. Our software platform provides industry leading tools for property owners and operators to manage their dynamic indoor information and build digital wayfinding experiences into their customer-facing applications.
Founded in 2011, Mappedin is headquartered in Waterloo, Canada. We work with clients in all industries around the world to help manage over 600M square feet of indoor space. In the last year, the Mappedin platform served over 140 million directions to people navigating the indoors.
Mappedin’s Product and Platform team is a group of developers responsible for Mappedin’s core products used by tens of millions of people: Our Pre-Built Mapping Applications, Developer Tools, and Indoor Mapping Software.
Who you are and what you'll do
You want to work with a team of developers that use machine learning to solve hard problems in real world, production environments. You understand ML techniques, but know that a cool model is nothing until you get it integrated into a great app used by actual users, with plans and tools to keep it up to date.
You’ll be joining the Super Auto team at Mappedin, which is a feature team comprised of Machine Learning, Front End, and Full Stack developers. They can take a new ML-powered tool from inception all the way to production, and keep it fresh once it’s deployed. As a Machine Learning Developer you will help bridge the gap between pure machine learning and feature deployment.
You are highly interested in learning about or already have experience in:
Machine learning (especially GANNs, object detection, semantic segmentation)
Computer Vision
Deep learning libraries and frameworks like Tensorflow/keras/Pytorch
ML Ops
Python
TypeScript
Test Driven Development
We understand that not everyone will be familiar with the tech stack or will check all of the boxes above. We would still love for you to apply and we will provide support if required!
What are some challenges?
You’ll need to know a bit about a bunch of different things. We don’t expect you to be an expert in coming up with the right ML technique to use for a given problem, but we do expect you to be able to pick up how to best help train, use, deploy, and maintain it. Most of Mappedin’s codebase is written in TypeScript, but the ML is done in Python, so you will end up using both languages, and the more you can push to TypeScript the more the rest of the Dev team can contribute.
Mappedin moves fast and we sometimes change directions. We can’t always wait for all the information before we try something. If you want us to guarantee exactly what you’ll be working on three months from now, we can’t give you that. On the other hand, there is a lot of high value work to do, and it won’t be boring.
Mappedin follows the Test Driven Development methodology to write code that is testable, tested, and only does what it needs to do. We don’t expect you to be an expert in TDD when you start, but we do expect you to become one. You also own the quality of your own work, and we expect you to prove that with your own integration and end to end tests.
Behind the scenes
We run an agile development process designed to give our developers as much uninterrupted development time as possible. Most days the only meeting you’re looking at is the morning standup.
We use a variety of technology and tools that currently include TypeScript, React, Jest, Three.js, Webpack, Node.js, Postgres, Kafka, MongoDB, and Docker.
There’s a lot of trust here at Mappedin. We are a REMOTE company. If you’re local, there will probably be a few days a week when you can expect other people to be in the office, but this role could also be fully remote. We work flexible hours, have a flexible vacation policy and work to provide the hardware or office equipment you require to unleash your potential. We will do what it takes to get things done if we said we would do it. We stay curious, challenge opinions, take risks, and learn from mistakes. We’re competitive and we like to win together. We want you to join us.

About SynapseBio
SynapseBio is a venture backed digital health company founded within AlleyCorp. We seek to improve the diagnosis, care decisions and treatment options for patients with neuropsychiatric illness by discovering, validating and commercializing machine learning derived digital biomarkers, beginning with quantitative electroencephalography (qEEG).

Over the past years, SynapseBio has developed and refined a domain specific process and algorithm trained to clean and standardize EEG data and generate ML features which has demonstrated efficacy in advanced disease detection across multiple neuropsychiatric disorders. The team is currently exploring the viability of diagnostic, prognostic, treatment monitoring, and treatment selection solutions through clinical partnerships and pilot studies. The key therapeutic areas in which these products are being developed are Alzheimer's disease and major depressive disorder.
About the Role
We are hiring a data scientist to guide machine learning efforts to diagnose and predict neuropsychiatric conditions using physiological data. The ideal candidate has strong analytical skills and high quality standards, is excited to learn new frameworks and techniques, and is able to build reliable models to solve clinically meaningful problems in the real world.

In this role, you will be working on a team with engineers and machine learning researchers to develop statistical and ML solutions for healthcare diagnostics and treatment areas, starting with Alzheimer's Disease and Major Depressive Disorder, among others.
You can expect to:
Provide statistically sound methodologies that support ML-based biomarker development, from the proof of concept to the regulatory strategy
Explore, analyze and assess multimodal physiological data, such as EEG, eye tracking, heart rate, and more to develop biomarkers for neuropsychiatric conditions
Identify and implement statistical and data science strategies to best utilize these data
Implement and develop data science and statistical tools following the company's engineering standards; conduct statistical reviews for products
Collaborate with our interdisciplinary team to identify data-driven insights for business value
Provide statistical input to support regulatory documentation and interactions with health authorities
Support protocol writing and study design, project reports and publications with statistical insights and validation
Keep up to date with data science innovations and statistical research to develop the highest performing models for healthcare applications.
We especially want you to apply if you have:
A Master's degree or PhD in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Medical Science, or related technical field
Demonstrable proficiency writing code in Python, in particular with scikit-learn, statsmodels, lifelines, dask, or pandas;
Experience working with physiological signals, such as electroencephalography (EEG), electromyography (EMG), eye tracking, heart rate
Familiarity with clinical trial design, regulatory processes and data science tools in production
A solid understanding of statistical principles and curiosity for latest methodologies
Understanding of deep learning as well as traditional ML models and their advantages and drawbacks across use cases
Experience applying data science and statistical analysis on real-world data
2+ years of industry experience in data science
Excellent presentation and communication skills – Ability to communicate data science and statistical concepts to a wide audience
About AlleyCorp Nord
We are a remote-first company and Montreal region is preferred, but we are open to candidates anywhere in the EST time zone in Canada. Our ideal start date is ASAP. AlleyCorp Nord, values the diversity of the people it hires and serves. Diversity, for us, means fostering a workplace in which a person's differences are recognized, appreciated, respected and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilize each person's talents and strengths.
Read more about AlleyCorp Nord and our culture (including benefits, etc) here. Working At AlleyCorp Nord.

Charger logistics invests time and support into its employees to provide them with the room to learn and grow their expertise and work their way up. Share your passion for Data Science with the broader enterprise community; identify and develop long-term processes, frameworks, tools, methods and standards.

Job Title: (CAN) Analyst, Business Systems and Analytics – Direct Store Delivery (12 month contract)
Job Description:
Job Type: Temporary (Fixed Term)
Schedule: Morning, afternoons, evenings, nights
Position Summary...
The Analyst, Business Systems and Analytics – Direct Store Delivery will report to the Manager, Direct Store Delivery and will work closely with a team of Analysts to provide ongoing data support for the DOME Project. After the launch of DOME, this role will be responsible for assisting with the ongoing enhancements and maintenance of the system. This role builds out the entire tableau portfolio for the DSD program and will also provide analytics to the Walmart freight program and tie reporting, analysis, and results to the original objects.
What you'll do...
1. Project Management: work with competing priorities and tight deadlines, while overseeing a long-term project timeline and hitting milestones. Focus on the day-to-day task such as data cleansing, verifying, and user testing.
2. Schedule/systems/database/tool development: support with the development process of Project DOME, reflecting user needs in the product and responsible for future enhancements. Once the model is completed, the Analyst will support with ongoing maintenance and enhancements to the code.
3. Data analytics: extract reliable data from various data sources, including the Scheduler, WTMS, Helios, and CDL, to support Project DOME and help the business identify pain points. Individual will also be responsible for the build and maintenance of all the tableau reporting and business analytics that get shared with cross-functional business stakeholders. Responsible for producing analytics to optimize scheduling between stores and DSD suppliers. Analyst will be required to consolidate data and taking into consideration project parameters (zoning, municipality restriction bylaws).
4. Data science: proficient in data mining, data engineering, coding (including, but not limited to, Python, Hadoop, SQL, VBA, R, Excel). Pulling data from shared data warehouses, LSS database, Helios, FourKites.
5. Technical communications: work with technical and non-technical teams and communicate complex topics in a simple, concise manner to both audiences. Take data and articulate it into tableaus for use by business leaders, suppliers, internal stakeholders (merchants, SC, Replenishment, store operations).
6. Business judgement: provide adhoc analyses for business partners to establish and align on realistic expectations.
7. Design thinking: create innovative business solutions that address business needs with a seamless user experience that works today and tomorrow.

We are looking for a software-oriented scientist or science-oriented software developer who wants to get a wide range of experience, and loves learning about physics, materials, chemistry, polymers, and electronics through a hands-on approach. This individual should:
Thrive working in a small, fast-paced team, leading the machine learning and software projects on the team, and making substantial contributions to the success of their projects
Be a generalist who can quickly learn and is willing and able to dive deep when necessary, specializing in specific topics as required
Be able to take a step back and manage a wide variety of tasks across different disciplines
Be good at collaborating with research scientists, engineers and specialists across different disciplines to drive cross-functional project development
Be a competent software developer who can maintain an existing (documented!) repository
Have a strong familiarity both with deep learning pipelines and software simulation of physical systems
Be comfortable working through problems and figuring things out with minimal supervision
Have familiarity with molecular structures, general chemistry, and basic physics
At Halion you will play an integral role in R&D and product development, ranging from material discovery to developing tools from physics simulations to project management applications.
We're a startup, so we're pretty relaxed about working hours, dress code, etc. We have heard that some candidates think "this sounds like a great place to work but there's no way I'm qualified..." - we are looking for good people, not just good experience! If your skills roughly align with what we've listed below, and you like the cut of our jib, give it a shot.
Perks
Employee benefits program (dental, vision, etc.)
Free coffee!
Flexible work hours
Control over your own project with a large impact on the final product
Responsibilities:
Maintaining and extending an existing code repository
Developing a deep learning pipeline using an existing project as a starting point, using cloud resources as well as on-site resources with the aim of improving the performance, accuracy and efficiency of quantum chemistry calculations and their application in advanced materials science
Developing code to work with existing datasets, and to create and work with new custom datasets
Interfacing with scientists and engineers to determine and satisfy project requirements
Design experiments; collect, analyze and interpret data; drive technical problem solving
Responsibly handling and working with sensitive and confidential information
Developing and running physics simulations using a variety of tools
Prototyping various software tools for other teams in the company to use
Programming microcontrollers to interface with prototypes as well as other electronic devices in order to meet technical specifications
Deep dive into literature to test, validate, and improve existing procedures and to develop new ones
Write research papers, abstracts, technical reports and SOPs
Effectively communicate project updates, difficulties and plans to team members
Train co-op students, contractors or other personnel; may supervise interns
Minimum qualifications:
BS or BASc in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, Computational Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, related field, or equivalent practical experience
Able to legally work in Canada
Competent Python developer - expert level not required, knowledge of algorithms not required, but you will be asked to code a few simple Python programs in an interview setting, and you may be asked to do a take-home development assignment
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills are required
Assets:
Ability to manage multiple complex projects and changing priorities, make sound decisions under pressure, and work effectively in a team environment
Ability to rapidly learn new systems and procedures
Experience working on challenging projects in a research environment. Ability to learn from failure and move on quickly to new strategies
Experience with Unix/Linux and HPC environments
Experience working with virtual environments, especially conda/miniconda
2+ years of professional experience building and deploying deep learning solutions
Experience with various machine learning frameworks, i.e. Tensorflow or Pytorch
Knowledge of Python is a requirement, other languages are a bonus
A link to your personal public git repository, or your open source contributions
Personal projects of any flavour: software, hardware, humanities, etc.
Experience with active, continuous, or transfer learning
Basic knowledge of chemistry, organic chemistry, electrostatics, and the physics of materials and molecules
Organization skills and the ability to use project management tools
Familiarity with standard operations and concepts within linear algebra
Good ability to visualize and manipulate 3D objects in your mind
Ability to travel internationally up to 6 weeks/yr.
Experience with electronics projects
Instructions to apply:
Do you want to be the very best [candidate], like no-one ever was? If so, please demonstrate the following in your cover letter and resume:
You have a bias for action (but you think before you act).
You enjoy working on personal projects not related to work (but you know how to manage your priorities).
You like technology - past, present and future.
You love learning new things, do so quickly, and can easily connect concepts from different fields.
You will use the word juxtaposition as naturally as possible in your application, so I know that you read this.
You like to solve problems, especially using your creativity and imagination.
You thrive in ambiguous environments that enable you to be creative.
Failure does not deter you from trying harder but you also know when to give up.
You derive your self worth from the effort you put in, and not from your successes or failures.
You are constantly working to experiment and improve yourself, because nobody is perfect.
An enjoyment of Star Wars is an asset. Bonus points if you can make a good Wookiee sound.
Our interview process will include up to 1 phone screen, 3 interviews, a short take-home assignment, and reference checks where applicable.

Job Description :
About Us

Amica Senior Lifestyles is setting a new standard for senior living in Canada by combining unparalleled premium hospitality and amenities with expert care and support to deliver a personalized senior living experience. Committed to enriching the lives of seniors now and as their needs change, Amica offers Independent Living (IL), Assisted Living (AL) and Memory Care (MC) lifestyle options. Established in 1996, the company owns and operates 33 residences in British Columbia, Alberta and Ontario, with plans to continue expansion in select markets.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Director, Research & Development Analytics, we are looking for an individual who is passionate about applying machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to support our investment strategy at Amica Senior Lifestyles. This individual will be working closely with cross-functional partners to research data science models and oversee end-to-end implementation of the models into production systems. Working with teams of diverse skillsets and backgrounds, lead research projects to solve the most difficult and convoluted problems an investment team has while taking additional responsibility of mentoring junior team members. With the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Data & Analytics, to continued growth and development with Amica Senior Lifestyles.

What you will be doing
Build and execute a long-term roadmap of elevating data science capabilities within Amica by researching, piloting, and introducing leading edge data technologies and products
Effectively plan and manage analytics projects, leading small technical teams
Define data science projects end to end including identifying opportunities, defining the problem, building proof of concepts, and deploying solutions to production
Conduct data mining, on assorted data sources, to extract insights and generate hypotheses for model development & testing
Perform data pre-processing, data integrity, feature selection, model selection analysis and identify opportunities to improve existing data models and techniques
Develop machine learning models and support the management of models throughout the model lifecycle, produce reusable machine learning pipelines while building models
Gain and maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and acquire ability to effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes
Guide and mentor data analysts in improving data quality and availability; help them create rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis
Balance multiple, competing priorities effectively, track documentation and deliverables in an organized manner
Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals

What you will bring

Master’s degree or PhD/Research, ideally in a discipline such as
Business Analytics / Business Intelligence
Computer Science,
Statistics,
Applied Science/ Engineering,
or related area
An understanding of data-driven technology with 5+ years’ experience in data and analytics environments
Solid experience working with complex datasets and building research-based data models
Strong foundation in supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning techniques, Feature Engineering, Classification, Clustering, Segmentation, NLP, Time Series Analysis and Demand Forecasting etc.
Knowledge of and experience with relational databases (SQL, PostgreSQL etc.)
Strong scripting and programming skills in Python /R
Excellent communication and presentation skills with fluency in translating business questions into actionable requirements
Proven team-management experience strongly preferred
Advanced MS Office user, ability to create powerful presentations and write high-quality executive reports
Quick learner, ability to work well in a team, and strong problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail and an ability to multi-task on simultaneous projects under tight deadlines

What you can expect from us

A diverse and inclusive environment where individual differences are celebrated, and you’re encouraged to be your best self
A collaborative environment where we work together to succeed as a team
Learning opportunities to help you grow and support for professional development and designations
Comprehensive benefit package including RRSP matching
Office is centrally located in the financial district, on the PATH and the TTC subway line, and provides easy access to downtown amenities
Participation in Amica’s Flex or Hybrid work model providing team members the opportunity to work a combination of days both in office and remotely

At Amica Senior Lifestyles we are passionate about working together in a supportive and inclusive environment that fosters innovation and turns ideas into action. We remain committed to creating workplaces that reflect the communities in which we operate. We are actively seeking applicants from all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, Black, Indigenous, racialized people, and persons with disabilities and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for our positions.

Amica Senior Lifestyles recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, team members and visitors from COVID-19. Effective October 2021, a condition of employment is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.
Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

#SO-Hiring-AMICA

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

The Data Scientist will join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics team within Data & Technology that applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable business-first solutions for sustainable growth at OMERS. The Data Scientist will work alongside analytics specialists on their team and partner with data and analytics specialists within businesses and corporate functions to design, develop, implement and scale advanced solutions following best practices to drive measurable business outcomes.

Reporting to the Director of Enterprise Data Science, you will work closely with our Businesses, Corporate Functions, Enterprise Architecture, Business Relationship Management, Infrastructure and Enterprise Service Management, Cyber, Data Engineering, Data Governance and Analytics Strategy teams to deploy new capabilities following leading product management and AI system methodologies. You will develop and nurture strong relationships with partners in a variety of different business units across our global portfolio, building an understanding of their needs and how to apply data, analytics and AI techniques to increase scale and operational efficiency, enhance self-service capabilities and elevate the understanding & application of these capabilities across the company.

The Data Scientist will partner with internal stakeholders and external partners to build out AI systems and deliver data analytics projects within set timelines. They meet objectives and focus on priorities which drive the successful operation of this Department and ensures alignment with OMERS business and technology strategy.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Fostering strong relationships among cross-functional teams and facilitating decision making within multi-level audiences. Applying a system thinking approach to lead execution of data, analytics and AI initiatives quickly and in collaboration with other teams
Driving the implementation of corporate/strategic objectives via AI/ML driven projects and seeing opportunities
Building ML projects from experiments and hands-on solutioning through to production
Implementing model tracking, updating, and auto-train capabilities in addition to accounting for drift and imbalance
Building and maintaining NLP models using state of the art techniques like transformers and seq2seq for the purposes of classification, sentiment analysis, entity extraction, and more
Driving analytics innovation by posing open ended questions, exploring new ideas, recommending the appropriate techniques to solve challenging business problems and rapid prototyping
Developing, deploying, and operationalizing data science products along with the supporting integrated tools and processes, including but not limited to security, performance, scalability, and extendibility
Hands on creation and oversight of analytical models, conducting model training, validation, testing, integrated reconciliations and ongoing data and model integrity maintenance
Remaining on the “leading edge” of emerging data, analytics and AI technologies and techniques to identify and implement novel tools and techniques and their application to new use cases and deployment opportunities
Driving a culture of innovation and AI by taking initiatives for activities such as lunch and learns, hackathons, paper readouts, etc.

To succeed in this role, you have:
A undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or any other quantitative field
Minimum five (5) years’ experience working in a data science/ Machine Learning environment
1-3+ years of experience leading and delivering enterprise-scale data science/ML projects and facilitating collaboration across teams
A proven grasp of the practical and theoretical aspects of statistical and deep learning such as data structures, algorithms, gradient descent, probability theory, linear algebra, calculus, hypothesis testing, and more
Experience building scalable and automated ML pipelines with strong Python programming skills
Natural language computing/understanding experience including but not limited to source data extraction, structuring, named entity extraction, sentiment analysis, topic modelling, and more
Experience with framework such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, MxNet and the sci-kit learn library
Proficiency with git is a must
Experience implementing pre-built models at scale along with retraining and implementing a custom deep-learning architecture is a strong plus
Experience working in the financial sector- ideally banks or investment firms, is an asset
Experience within Pensions, Investments and Commercial Real Estate sectors are an asset
Hands-on experience with big data systems such as Spark, Hadoop, Hive and ideally cloud technologies such as Azure Data Factory, AzureML, Azure Synapse, Google Fusion, Google BigQuery, AWS SageMaker, and others
Experience in using external/alternative data, data modeling, data architecture, data engineering, insight generation, data visualization, feature engineering and AI systems development & optimization
A passion around learning new technologies and analytical techniques with a track record of acting on this in prior roles and in their free time through projects, partnerships, mentoring and hackathons
Demonstrated experience as a leader in creatively addressing unique or ambiguous situations and motivating teams and delivering multiple projects simultaneously serving multiple stakeholders
The ability to build relationships and facilitate across a diverse group of stakeholders in several different business units
Demonstrated experience applying product management, design thinking and human centered design
Polished written and verbal communication and presentation skills targeted at all levels of the organization

Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

At SCI our people make us even better, which is why we want you to be a part of our fast growing organization. SCI recognizes that having a great team is the key to success, which is why we attract and retain the right people with an employee experience that focuses on building trust, embracing change, and achieving our goals together. Any one of our 3000 industry experts will tell you that we take on some of Canada’s toughest service and logistic challenges in specialized transportation, technical services, and supply chain management. For 30 years, our proficient planning and flexible solutions have brought us top tier clients. With clear focus, operational excellence, and future growth at the core of our operation, we apply out-of-the-box thinking to deliver exceptional experiences that take our clients to the next level. Are you ready for your next challenge?
As BI Analyst, the incumbent will be responsible for implementation of new customer projects, change requests and managing day to day support of the business inquiries and BI environment. He/she will participate as part of a team in design and implementation of standardized reporting & analytics processes to support current and future reporting needs of business.
What success looks like:
· You work closely with stakeholders across the business to define, analyze, document and implement BI and visualization solutions.
· You actively seek out opportunities to add business value through reporting and analytics
· You are a key participant in the conceptual design of BI report development / dashboard & visualization solutions that meet business objectives in compliance with best practices
· You support our internal stakeholders on requests for BI analytics with solution design from the bottom up, addressing: data modeling, analytical structure, security and BI visualization
· You execute the design, development & support of reporting and dashboard solutions using PowerBI & Qlik Sense
· Together with the BI Manager and IT / Data team, you collaborate on the design of BI/BW data models, data store objects, and information stores to sustain current and future needs
· You assist in Design/Develop custom data sources based on business requirements in SAP or non-SAP systems or enhance standard SAP data sources
· You prepare required reporting suite documentation including (but not limited to): functional specifications, design documents, testing documents (including use cases) and product release notes.
· For reports/dashboards created by BI Team, provide support and maintenance of the Qlik Sense/ PowerBI environments including data loads, data integrity and accuracy.
· You execute customer support including (but not limited to) training, investigation & troubleshooting of inquiries/tickets
· You assist in developing, documenting and implementing enterprise reporting standards and best .
What you bring to the role:
· A Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Data Science or related field
· 5+ years of experience design/implementation BI report development/dashboard & visualization solutions, incorporating best practices
· Experience with data visualization tools including Qlik view/Qlick Sense, PowerBI and/or other visualization methodologies & best practices
· Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills
· Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced team environment
· You have solid BI analytics and dashboard development knowledge. Supply Chain or Retail Operations experience a plus.
Who you are:
· You are results-oriented, with a strong focus on on-time, on-budget, on-scope and on-quality delivery.
· You have the courage to think differently about how things get done to continuously improve and deliver even better results every day.
· The safety, health, and well-being of yourself and your team, is your first priority.
· Providing exceptional service is your passion.
· You apply your strong analytical and critical thinking skills when problem solving.
· When making decisions, you consider relevant stakeholders and engage those who can add value to the process.
· You are nimble in your approach and prioritize with focus on what adds value to the stakeholders and customers.
· Experience configuring and enhancing standard data sources.
· Working knowledge of Scale WMS, SAP WMS, and TMS platforms preferred.
Working at SCI:
First and foremost, at SCI, we are committed to creating a safe and healthy work environment, which is why we support our people with programs that serve the health and wellness of everyone. We also recognize that business moves quickly, and we strongly believe that success in our fast-paced environment is defined by the achievements of all our employees. We pride ourselves in the collaborative approach we apply to our work, and with a flat organizational structure, each employee at SCI is empowered to make a difference every day. Our people find success through their desire to discover new strengths, learn new skills, and gain unique experiences. With a balanced compensation portfolio, we encourage our people to lead with agility and strive for excellence.
SCI is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
We thank all candidates for applying, however, only successful candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Job Title: SENIOR MANAGER, DATA & ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) (Toronto, Hybrid)
Job Description:
Location: Pickering, ON, CA, L1W 3J2
Req ID: 40802
BE THE GENERATION to help build a brighter tomorrow.
Every generation has a challenge that defines them. At OPG, we are calling on all innovators, disruptors, thought leaders and change-makers. Join us as we electrify life in one generation and build a sustainable future powered by our electricity, our ideas, and our people.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, data science, advanced analytics, business intelligence, data, artificial intelligence, computer science or business.
Five plus years of progressive experience in IT strategy, governance, data, advanced analytics, business, or artificial intelligence.
Strong interpersonal skills; experience building and maintaining productive relationships and partnerships across the business with various stakeholders internally and externally, technical and non-technical.
Excellent presentation skills, with strong verbal/written communication skills; ability to build strategic and impactful communications and present to senior and executive management.
Experience working with big data environment; knowledge of data management tools, data transformation, technical analytics, data policies and procedures.
Experience leading digital transformations; with the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) platforms and applications and machine learning (ML) solutions.
Demonstrated experience in taking a project from strategy to implementation; previous consulting experience successfully leading and advising cross-function, indirect teams of resources to execute high-impact projects.
Previous management experience effectively leading, influencing and motivating a team of technical professionals.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Understanding of applications, databases, data marts and data lakes.
Naturally curious, strong problem solver; ability to synthesize complex problems into clear next steps and recommendations.
Experience designing, executing, and continuously improving business processes in a complex and challenging business environment.
Strong business and financial acumen; extensive knowledge and understanding of business financials, budgets, legal concepts, commercial contracts, and laws.
Experience working in/for/on behalf of highly regulated and complex industries/organizations.

WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

ABOUT THE ROLE: As part of the CIO, reporting to the Director, Enterprise Digital Technology, you will deliver strategic initiatives to inform and engage staff, leaders, and key stakeholders; to advance awareness, and understanding of risks, opportunities with data and artificial intelligence; leveraging innovative technology and IT solutions to help advance OPG and its key strategic priorities.

You will also be responsible for building out and delivering OPG’s Data and AI strategy, building a team of professionals responsible for developing an environment that provides advice, internal consulting, and support to advance innovative technology capabilities. In this role, you will promote the company’s data and AI strategy and priorities, developing a data-driven decision culture while building technical capabilities across the CIO and the organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Data & AI Leadership: Develop and execute OPG’s Data and AI strategies and roadmaps, aligning technology priorities to strategic business growth, goals and objectives.
Thought Leadership & Business Advisory: Manage and grow an AI Center of Excellence, where the department provides expertise, consulting and advisory services while supporting the business need/project. Represent OPG with external stakeholders, speaking at conferences and events, and representing the CIO Data and AI business unit with staff and internal stakeholders.
Industry Best Practices: Actively monitor the market for trends and developments to prepare recommendations-experience directing data and AI processes, including developing, coordinating and recommending innovative approaches, processes, policies and procedures.
Data Analysis: Manage, monitor, and support the progress of various ongoing projects and initiatives exploring data analysis, from proof of concept, experimentation, and decision-making techniques.
Process Improvements: Develop innovative solutions and improve the efficiency of existing business processes, focusing on adding value and business benefits. Drive continuous improvement, curiosity, data literacy, and a data-driven, informed decision culture.
Project Management: In this role, you will manage a balanced portfolio of projects that span from disruptive initiatives to growth and innovative projects, ensuring each is prioritized and the continued cadence on each.
IT Governance: Support the establishment of standards, processes, and governance to support Data and AI capability within the CIO and across the business.
Financial Management: Assist with developing and managing the yearly budget to support the CIO, and manage the assigned budget for the Data and AI business unit.
Team Development & Management: Provide strategic direction, develop and supervise a team of technical resources (approx. four direct reports), ensuring strong performance. Develop through mentorship, role modelling and real-time guidance. At the same time, continuing to build engagement and curiosity.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU

This is an exciting opportunity to work in an environment where you will contribute to Ontario Power Generation’s continued growth and success in generating clean, safe, reliable, low-cost power sustainably. Here’s why OPG might be the ideal workplace for you:
Have an active role in helping advance critical energy projects that will make a meaningful difference in the fight against climate change.
OPG cares about the safety and well-being of our employees. It is our utmost priority.
We offer a supportive work environment where you can be your best daily.
Learn from the best; be part of an industry-leading innovative organization where you have access to opportunities across a diverse mix of work in the energy sector.
Competitive total rewards package with retirement savings of a defined benefit pension plan.
Be part of a growing industry where the demand for our power will only grow in importance as we further electrify the economy.
Flexible work arrangement and hybrid working environment.
Exceptional range of opportunities to stretch, advance and develop.
Work for a business that cares and is committed to building a sustainable future. Our public commitments help hold us accountable for OPG’s climate change plan, Our Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy, and Our Reconciliation Action Plan.
Participate and volunteer in some of the many ways OPG gives back to the communities where we operate.
Be part of making a difference in the lives of fellow Ontarians and Canadians. Electricity is vital to the province, and OPG's clean electricity is helping decarbonize other sectors.

OUR PROMISE TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION: OPG is committed to accelerating equity, celebrating diversity, and fostering a culture of inclusion where all employees are valued, respected and supported. Appropriate arrangements can be made if you require accommodation during the application or interview process. NEW CAMPUS: In 2025, (OPG) is establishing a new corporate headquarters in Durham Region. The new campus will provide a cutting-edge work environment that fosters collaboration and innovation.

ABOUT ONTARIO POWER GENERATION (OPG): We continue to set the bar for environmental protection, community involvement and economic impact - all while safely keeping the lights on. Now we've set out sights on https://www.opg.com/climate-change/ and a catalyst to help the economies where we operate achieve net-zero by 2050.

OPG operates a https://www.opg.com/powering-ontario/our-generation/, including; nuclear, hydroelectric, biomass, natural gas, and solar. We are also a clean-tech leader and innovator, offering challenging and unique work opportunities. Help us use our power to change the world.

Summary of the position: The employer is looking for looking for a Data Lead who will contribute through their knowledge, skills, and expertise in data modeling and analysis to support our Data and Analytics team that delivers a full range of data and psychometric services in e-assessment and e-learning at the primary, secondary, and post-secondary levels.

Designs, documents (including technical specifications), and conducts analyses for data models, ETL processes, and other key data deliverables.

Demonstrates communication skills (oral, written, and business) necessary to function effectively as primary contact with internal and external stakeholders. (1 year Required)
Demonstrated statistical, and data science skills.
Competence in manipulating and analyzing high-volume, high-dimensional, heterogeneous data.
Demonstrated ability to validate & interpret data across the entire data life cycle, bridging the gaps between data gathering, analysis, and reporting.
Capable of delivering effective modeling and analytics results.
Experience leading a data team to deliver data in line with client needs & expectations.
Strong grasp of data fundamentals.
Bonus:
Familiarity with big-data tools.
Familiarity with item response theory (IRT) and/or student assessment
Experience with an assessment program that has gone through a complete operational cycle.
Experience working in a small, dynamic team in a start-up environment.
Experience working in agile teams or software development environments.

About SE Health:
SE Health is a national health care provider that has been opening the door to new possibilities and experiences for more than a century. Recognized as Canada’s largest social enterprise, we employ 8,000 people and visit 18,000 clients every day. Through the Saint Elizabeth Research Centre, Health Career Colleges, the Saint Elizabeth Foundation and our leadership in person and family centered care, we are helping to make the future of health care brighter and stronger. Saint Elizabeth Health Care was awarded the Canada Order of Excellence in 2015.
This role is classified as hybrid where you would be primarily working remote, but may be asked to come into our head office in Markham as needed.
Position Summary
Do you believe in the insights driven organization? If data, analytics and its impact on the health care excites you, join the team at Saint Elizabeth Health Care and be part of the data driven transformation. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst (BIA) to join a team of passionate and driven individuals who help equip business with insights and data to make a difference in the community.
Business Intelligence Analyst is a new role within the data team who is involved in BI strategy formulation, stakeholder engagement and data communication. The incumbent will be a hands-on analyst who is involved with end-to-end delivery of BI products. BIA will liaison with the business to build strong knowledge of the business operations and help understand and capture business requirements. They will then champion these requirements and collaborate closely with technical teams to realize it into dashboards, reports, KPIs and alerts. To achieve this, the incumbent will facilitate and lead information gathering sessions, create formal documentation (BPMN, UML, etc), and build presentation of insights with business. The successful candidate will need to be adept in creating stunning data visualizations and be comfortable with reading and modifying SQL queries. Finally, BIA will collaborate with department managers to create and maintain BI and data strategies, as well as to provide training to other teams.
Responsibilities:
Requirements Gathering, Analysis and Documentation
Work with business to understand requirements and turn them into user stories / formal specification documents – become the owner of the business requirements from the BI team perspective
Develop deep knowledge about business processes and their data and analytics needs
Formal documentation of workflows using standardized specifications: BPMN and/or UML
Go beyond the obvious to identify Intelligence related data insights requirements and use cases
Data Visualization
Storytelling with data: create articulate and visually appealing visuals using BI tools including MicroStrategy, MS BI Stack, etc.
Collaborate closely with BI developers to develop dashboards, reports and present key insights to stakeholders
Assist multiple projects in evaluating, validating, and capturing data / analytics needs
Be a BI strategist: assist with creation and adherence to BI strategies
Support Stakeholders and BI Users
Be proactive in helping team to improve in how intelligence related services are being delivered
Support business user community – be the BI contact person when it comes to training
Assist in creation of training material for business users community as required
Learn the BI tool and train others in business to help drive self-serve dashboard approach in organization
QA
Conduct QA activities such as data validation, creating test cases and testing as required
Create SQL queries to conduct data quality and data validation tasks and to automate testing
Assist in development of the test plan and execution
Verify that data quality is maintained; take initiatives to highlight issues and help resolve them
based on industry best practices, continuously improve the user experience, and conduct research in recent trends and data science concepts.
Requirement:
College degree, Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Systems, Business Management, Computer Science/Software Engineering, Research Methods, Health Informatics, or specialized training / certification
1+ years of experience in the analytics / data related business analysis area
Healthcare experience is considered a strong plus
Proven and established track-record of creating stunning data visualizations. This is a key factor in selecting the candidate.
Strongly recommended that you bring with you a portfolio of past data visualization work
Good understanding of data management, analytics and business intelligence concepts
Working understanding of reporting / business intelligence tools
Knowledge / practical experience in SQL, data mining, data warehouse (T-SQL is preferred)
Understanding of RDBM concepts and data analytics
QA/data validation experience via SQL – preferably using scripts
Knowledge of diagramming tools such as Visio, Draw.io, or similar
Understanding of ML/AI concepts is considered a strong asset
Understanding of Python is considered an asset
Self-motivated, ability to take direction and work independently
Ability to work well in a team environment
Passionate to learn and help make a change in the healthcare industry through innovation
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Attention to detail and produce quality work outputs

If you want to work on a bold new business venture that could benefit millions of people and usher in a new era of healthcare, this could be the role for you.

Molecular You is a health-tech start-up on a mission to help people live longer, healthier lives. We give individuals unparalleled insight into their health and help them avoid chronic disease while also helping organizations understand disease and disease progression differently.

We use a unique blood test and machine learning to identify early warning signs of chronic diseases and give users simple but targeted recommendations to avert disease progression.

We are looking for a junior data analyst to help us uncover insights from our biological data and help us design and run machine learning experiments to develop new models that can predict disease.

At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. From a coffee connoisseur’s review of a neighborhood cafe, to a homeowner’s request for a quote to remodel their kitchen, Yelp’s data captures millions of user-business interactions every day.

The Data Science & Analytics team prides itself on harnessing the power of this data. We test and learn, build tools and lead meaningful analyses to extract insights that influence Yelp’s product and business strategy.

We’re looking for a self-motivated critical thinker whose intellectual curiosity is met with a healthy dose of skepticism. You value the integrity of your work, sanity check analyses before drawing conclusions, and take pride in telling stories with data. You are a team player who is an excellent communicator, quick learner, and as excited about Yelp as we are.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada.
Where You Come In:
Lead broad analytics projects core to Yelp’s business, communicate key insights to decision makers, and help product leaders uncover new opportunities.
Manage tight deadlines and quickly iterate analyses to answer unstructured business questions, deliver actionable learnings, and make strategic recommendations.
Work cross-functionally with product and engineering to define, log, and track Yelp’s key product metrics and opportunity size new initiatives.
Generate dashboards and automate reports that empower teams across the organization to make data-driven decisions.
Grow and maintain impactful relationships with stakeholders of both technical and non technical backgrounds with clear and frequent communication.
Think critically about experimental design and advocate for thoughtful experimentation.

What It Takes to Succeed:
BA/BS or graduate degree in a quantitative field (mathematics, statistics, economics etc.) or equivalent experience
Ideally 3 or more years of quantitative industry experience, ideally within the consumer product space
Excellent SQL skills, fluency in Python, and experience with at least one statistical package (R, Pandas/NumPy/SciPy/matplotlib, Stata, Matlab).
An eye for compelling data visualization and extensive experience with related tools (Tableau, Mode, Looker).
Solid understanding of statistical inference, experimental design and analytic bias. Familiarity with financial modeling and advanced statistics (regression, non parametrics, predictive modeling) a plus.

Local businesses are turning to Yelp because we’re uniquely positioned to help them reach their customers during these challenging times. Our Engineering & Product teams have responded by quickly identifying their needs and building innovative products and features to support them. Our commitment to connecting people with great local businesses has never been stronger.

About SynapseBio
SynapseBio is a venture backed digital health company founded within AlleyCorp. We seek to improve the diagnosis, care decisions and treatment options for patients with neuropsychiatric illness by discovering, validating and commercializing machine learning derived digital biomarkers, beginning with quantitative electroencephalography (qEEG).

Over the past years, SynapseBio has developed and refined a domain specific process and algorithm trained to clean and standardize EEG data and generate ML features which has demonstrated efficacy in advanced disease detection across multiple neuropsychiatric disorders. The team is currently exploring the viability of diagnostic, prognostic, treatment monitoring, and treatment selection solutions through clinical partnerships and pilot studies. The key therapeutic areas in which these products are being developed are Alzheimer's disease and major depressive disorder.
About the Role
We are hiring a data scientist to guide machine learning efforts to diagnose and predict neuropsychiatric conditions using physiological data. The ideal candidate has strong analytical skills and high quality standards, is excited to learn new frameworks and techniques, and is able to build reliable models to solve clinically meaningful problems in the real world.

In this role, you will be working on a team with engineers and machine learning researchers to develop statistical and ML solutions for healthcare diagnostics and treatment areas, starting with Alzheimer's Disease and Major Depressive Disorder, among others.
You can expect to:
Provide statistically sound methodologies that support ML-based biomarker development, from the proof of concept to the regulatory strategy
Explore, analyze and assess multimodal physiological data, such as EEG, eye tracking, heart rate, and more to develop biomarkers for neuropsychiatric conditions
Identify and implement statistical and data science strategies to best utilize these data
Implement and develop data science and statistical tools following the company's engineering standards; conduct statistical reviews for products
Collaborate with our interdisciplinary team to identify data-driven insights for business value
Provide statistical input to support regulatory documentation and interactions with health authorities
Support protocol writing and study design, project reports and publications with statistical insights and validation
Keep up to date with data science innovations and statistical research to develop the highest performing models for healthcare applications.
We especially want you to apply if you have:
A Master's degree or PhD in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Medical Science, or related technical field
Demonstrable proficiency writing code in Python, in particular with scikit-learn, statsmodels, lifelines, dask, or pandas;
Experience working with physiological signals, such as electroencephalography (EEG), electromyography (EMG), eye tracking, heart rate
Familiarity with clinical trial design, regulatory processes and data science tools in production
A solid understanding of statistical principles and curiosity for latest methodologies
Understanding of deep learning as well as traditional ML models and their advantages and drawbacks across use cases
Experience applying data science and statistical analysis on real-world data
2+ years of industry experience in data science
Excellent presentation and communication skills – Ability to communicate data science and statistical concepts to a wide audience
About AlleyCorp Nord
We are a remote-first company and Montreal region is preferred, but we are open to candidates anywhere in the EST time zone in Canada. Our ideal start date is ASAP. AlleyCorp Nord, values the diversity of the people it hires and serves. Diversity, for us, means fostering a workplace in which a person's differences are recognized, appreciated, respected and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilize each person's talents and strengths.
