Job Description:
About The Role::
Journey is looking for experienced, energetic, data scientist with an interest in teaching. As a Data Science Instructor, you will be responsible for leading lectures on various topics, assigning course work, grading, and mentoring students on a 1-1 basis. You will work closely with other instructors and members of our education team, and follow along with our pre-built curriculum and teacher guide. You will work as an instructor for our Concordia Bootcamps program (a partnership between us and Concordia University) and have a direct impact on changing peoples lives through education.

We're currently seeking instructors for the following part-time bootcamps:

January 22 to August 31, 2023 (7 months)
Tue & Thu 6:30-10pm ET, Sun 10am to 5pm ET

January 21, 2023 to February 14, 2024 (13 months)
Mon & Wed 6:30-10pm ET, 8x Saturdays 10am to 5pm ET

January 21, 2023 to February 17, 2024 (13 months)
Saturdays 10am to 5pm ET, 8x Sundays 10am to 5pm ET

This is a part-time contractual position.

You can review the program and upcoming course dates here: https://concordiabootcamps.ca/courses/full-stack-immersive/ (https://concordiabootcamps.ca/courses/full-stack-immersive/)

Salary & Benefits::
$15,000 - $20,000 CAD for length of contract, depending on your experience (paid in monthly instalments)
Fully remote work
Work with an amazing and fun team
Possibility to extend your contract and teach more courses
Responsibilities::
Teach a class of beginners (in collaboration with 1-2 other instructors and the Lead Instructor) with the goal of ensuring they graduate ready for junior level roles in Data Science
Act as coach/mentor to students as they work their way through the course
Care profoundly about every student's success
Present lectures on Math, Stats, Python, Pandas, SQL, Data Visualization, and more
Communicate regularly with the Administration Team and Lead Instructor to provide ongoing updates on the students' process and feedback
Follow each student independently and ensure that they develop a mastery of the subject matter
About You::
Experience teaching (as a TA), coaching, managing or supporting junior staff or managing projects
Experience in the field of Data Science, have graduated from a Data Science Bootcamp and/or have an educational background in Data Science
Outgoing, personable, friendly and empathetic
Comfortable explaining difficult concepts because of your ability to dissect and disseminate them into bite-sized, understandable ideas
Well-versed in both front-end and back-end development
Strong active listening skills and ability to motivate
Ability to help all students equally - both those that are excelling and those who are falling behind, with patience, kindness and empathy
Lifelong learner who loves sharing their learnings and experiences with others
Loves the idea of helping people lead better lives through education
Schedule Expectations:
Outside of the schedule outlined above, instructors should also expect approximately 10-15 hours of onboarding the week prior to the start of the bootcamp and 5-10 hours of grading and off-boarding the week after the end of the bootcamp. This amounts to a total of approximately 500 hours of work for the entire duration of the contract.

About Journey Education:
Journey provides digital skills training with courses, workshops, and events all offered online. Our product lineup currently includes courses in Web Development and Data Science, with new products on the way. Founded in 2014 and headquartered in Montreal, Canada, Journey works with highly experienced instructors to develop cutting-edge, real-world training and meaningful educational products that help people unlock their potential.

At Journey, we are building an environment where our employees feel included and heard. Diversity and inclusion are important to us and we strongly encourage applications from minorities, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

Position Summary:
The successful candidate will assist in leveraging customer, digital and transportation datasets to create insights on pricing, marketing and customer behavior. The Data Scientist will assist the Director of Data Analytics and other key stakeholders to bring actionable data driven solutions to 407etr. This job involves model design, data management, data queries, and providing input into programs and policies. This position is part of a highly collaborative and energetic team in a start-up minded environment.
Direct Relationships:
Director, Data Analytics
Senior Data Scientist
Position Responsibilities:
Assemble and analyze data to understand customer behavior from existing 407 ETR data, external data sources and emerging sources.
Build and maintain machine learning models to identify revenue opportunities.
Undertake analysis of target customer groups (segments) for specific marketing and pricing programs and assess opportunities and strategies for marketing.
Ad hoc analysis and modeling of data.
Ability to understand business stakeholder’s issues and create valuable insight.
Raise awareness and action of data science within the company to help focus on fact based decisions.
Support the Department along with the Information Technology Management Department in planning the structure and storage of new customer related data fields.
Represent the department in committees within the organization.
Qualifications:
A University degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science.
Minimum 2 years working experience with data science techniques: clustering, regression models, classification, anomaly detection, or and other machine learning techniques.
Minimum 5 years of experience with data analysis tools (eg. SAS, R or Python) and BI visualization for reporting.
Well-developed business analysis, research and creative problem solving skills.
Organizational skills and time management skills; planning and project management, and ability to meet multiple deadlines.
Strong communication skills and work ethic.
Highly collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
Summary
407 ETR's Information Technology division is responsible for the infrastructure and software to enable the efficient operation of the highway-including toll capture, account management, financials, and data storage/analytics-as well as customer services including call-center, web, IVR and supporting workflows.
Delivery is accomplished using an Agile-Scrum approach, including self-organization, short iterations, strong collaboration, and dedicated teams in scrum rooms.
At 407, all developers meet weekly to briefly hear updates from management, then break off into multiple learning streams. Topics include Cloud, Best Practices in Java, Data Streaming, SalesForce and Data Science. Some weeks, the streams are very hands-on (i.e. getting AWS.CLI up and running, playing with Kubernetes, learning Python). The developer led topics range from a learning above a wide variety of topics (i.e. Cloud, Best Practices in Java, Data Streaming, SalesForce, Data Science...).
About 407ETR
Highway 407 ETR is an all-electronic open-access toll highway located in the Greater Toronto Area. The highway spans 108 kilometres from Burlington in the west to Pickering in the east.
On Highway 407 ETR, we offer peace of mind and a fast, safe and reliable trip. That’s why millions of drivers rely on Highway 407 ETR to get around the GTA. Every driver we serve is one less vehicle on a congested alternate route, giving drivers more time for the things that matter most.
407 International Inc. is the sole shareholder of 407 ETR and is owned by:
Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments) through indirectly-owned subsidiaries (50.01%);
Cintra Global S.E. which is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Ferrovial S.A. (43.23%); and
SNC-Lavalin (6.76%).
We’re a majority Canadian owned company and employ over 460 Ontarians. Learn more at 407etr.com
Note:
This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

Description

You love technology, you love to learn and you have a global mindset. You are passionate about Data Science, Big Data, Machine Learning and making a tangible difference for customers. We are part of Business Networks & Systems (BNS) of Telus Partner Solutions Group exclusively working on Wholesale and Partner customers of Telus. We are looking for someone like you to work with us to transform, modernize and automate our reporting and processes as we grow our business and deliver a world class experience for our customers. If you have a burning desire to get into ICT, Telus Partner Solutions is the best place to learn about the telecom industry, as we manage the buy and sell to traditional and non-traditional ICT companies globally. We are different because:

We have an amazing, entrepreneurial team culture
The Partner team is the first to see future ICT global trends and is willing to try new approaches
We are the ICT industry experts

You will play a key role in delivering mission critical business data, analysis and process automation, to drive continuous business improvement, and achieve best in class customer experience. You will develop your talents in business analysis, process automation leadership, and project management. All you have to do is bring your passion, great attitude, and grit. Are you ready for the challenge?

What you’ll do


Our corporate Co-op program will help drive your learning, development, and ultimately your career.

Our Co-op and Internship programs offer You the ability to:

Build networks of contacts across the company who will support and challenge you, they will help you sharpen your skills
Identify and follow through on opportunities for improvement and innovation that directly impact our team, our business and our customers
Learn and grow constantly through coaching and mentoring, interacting with senior management, and participating in formal and informal development opportunities
Work in a flexible environment facilitated by technologies that enable effective collaboration nationally regardless of whether you work from the office or from home
Enjoy many rewarding opportunities to build new relationships and give back to the community in which you live

Qualifications

What you bring

Education - Pursuing a undergrad degree in Computer/Software Engineering/Business/Data Science/Applied Science/Commerce/Statistics with computers major/minor
Programming Skills - Thorough working knowledge on Python, SQL, ReactJS, GSuite, Tableau, Unix and Windows Scripts
Data addict - one who loves to organize data to make it more informative and valuable, find hidden patterns in data to reveal new information
Enhance and optimize reporting processes with self-serve & automation, and data research/analytics to provide insight into fulfillment intervals and customer experience
Identify and deliver reporting process improvements to move manual reporting to fully self-serve and automated solutions (e.g. using automated data extraction & presenting information on Tableau)
Assist in cultivating a fact-based-data-driven decision making culture and implement the best-in- class end-to-end modeling/analytical process to gain operational efficiency

Great-to-haves

Prior experience on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) applications - Big Query, Dataflow, PySpark, Looker
Familiarity with Data wrangling tools and ETL pipelines such as SAS, Dataflux, Alteryx, Apache Airflow
Certifications on BI Tools such as Tableau/Power BI/Looker

Founded in 2014, Spring Financial has spent the last 7 years simplifying the lending process for millions of Canadians facing every type of financial circumstance. In the process, we’ve become the largest fintech loan originator in the country with over 50,000 monthly applicants and over 250,000 loans originated!

Many Canadians have been locked out of the financial system and are stuck without the credit they need, unable to save money and paying extremely high interest rates. At Spring, our mission is to provide all Canadians access to fair-priced financial products. We do this through a variety of products including our signature savings and credit-building product, The Foundation Loan, and our personal loan offering, the Evergreen Loan. We’ve made all of our products available to Canadians from the comfort of their own home and without having to visit a branch!

Our team is growing fast, and we’re looking for a Data Analyst to join us. We're looking for someone who understands the data-driven decision making needs of a high-growth organization who is focused on concrete outcomes and KPIs.

This role will report to the Manager, Data & Analytics as part of the Data & Analytics department.

What You'll be doing:
Create data-driven insights in order to enrich the end-user experience
Communicate with multiple teams by creating reports in order to share insights and overall data story
Maintain, enhance and automate operational reports to support decision making
Extract, prepare, clean and process large amounts of data to support various data analyses and projects
Work with high level stakeholders to scope analytics projects to ensure data analytics deliveries are driving business impact

What You Should Already Have:
A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field, such as Finance, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics or a similar technical discipline
3+ years experience in applying analytics, data engineering or data science
Proficiency in working with SQL, Python and/or R across complex real world datasets
Proficiency in using modern data visualization tools, such as Tableau (preferred), PowerBI or similar
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Aptitude for critical thinking as it relates to complex problems and challenge assumptions in order to implement creative solutions

What Would Be Nice To Have:
Familiarity with Snowflake & AWS ecosystem
Experience applying data analytics within consumer finance, fintech and other Financial Industry domains
Familiarity with related disciplines such as consumer finance, project management, user experience design, software development and digital marketing

This is a truly exciting time to join Spring Financial and we are looking forward to doing great things together! In addition to a competitive salary, we provide:
A remote working environment
Extended dental, medical and vision benefits
Opportunities for advancement
Excellent on the job training

Are you passionate about applying experimentation, causal inference, analysis, and machine learning models to make high-quality, high-impact decisions? Do you want to help local businesses grow and succeed? Yelp’s Ad Market Dynamics team works on challenging, multi-disciplinary problems at scale—spanning economics, machine learning, statistics, and engineering—with the goal of creating a healthy, valued marketplace between customers and advertisers.

As an Applied Scientist at Yelp, you will help improve our marketplace for customers and advertisers by applying your knowledge of experimental and observational analysis alongside modeling and mechanism design. The range of problems you may take on here at Yelp includes:
How should we design our ad systems with the right incentives to promote a healthy marketplace?
How should we improve our dynamic auction system for advertisers?
What causal mechanisms underpin our advertising systems?
How can we best design an experiment to measure complex network effects?

Yelp Engineering and Applied Science culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. We encourage autonomy and development from the outset, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager, mentor, and team. Learn more about Yelp by visiting: Culture at Yelp / Yelp Fact Sheet / Diversity at Yelp / Yelp Engineering Blog / Yelp Blog / Yelp Open Source / Yelp Economic Average.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don’t feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada.
Where You Come In:
Identify and own complex problems, form testable hypotheses and drive significant business impact.
Conduct end-to-end analyses, from wrangling data via SQL or Python, to statistical modeling, to hypothesizing and presenting business ideas.
Communicate your conclusions to technical and non-technical audiences alike.
Develop and deploy ML models into production and continuously improve their performance.
Keep the team and our projects current on new developments in experimentation and modeling.

What It Takes to Succeed:
Background in economics/econometrics (Masters/PhD or equivalent practical experience).
Ideally 3+ years of working experience.
Understanding of marketplaces and incentive design when solving business problems.
Experience with data analysis/modeling/statistical tools (e.g. Python/R/SQL).
Ability to apply economic and econometric analysis to real-world problems.
Highly motivated and curious—able to combine business insight with deep understanding of tools and systems.

What You'll Get:
This opportunity has the option to be fully remote in all locations across Canada.
You can find more information about Yelp's five star benefits here!

Who we are and what we do
Mappedin powers search and discovery indoors. Our software platform provides industry leading tools for property owners and operators to manage their dynamic indoor information and build digital wayfinding experiences into their customer-facing applications.
Founded in 2011, Mappedin is headquartered in Waterloo, Canada. We work with clients in all industries around the world to help manage over 600M square feet of indoor space. In the last year, the Mappedin platform served over 140 million directions to people navigating the indoors.
Mappedin’s Product and Platform team is a group of developers responsible for Mappedin’s core products used by tens of millions of people: Our Pre-Built Mapping Applications, Developer Tools, and Indoor Mapping Software.
Who you are and what you'll do
You want to work with a team of developers that use machine learning to solve hard problems in real world, production environments. You understand ML techniques, but know that a cool model is nothing until you get it integrated into a great app used by actual users, with plans and tools to keep it up to date.
You’ll be joining the Super Auto team at Mappedin, which is a feature team comprised of Machine Learning, Front End, and Full Stack developers. They can take a new ML-powered tool from inception all the way to production, and keep it fresh once it’s deployed. As a Machine Learning Developer you will help bridge the gap between pure machine learning and feature deployment.
You are highly interested in learning about or already have experience in:
Machine learning (especially GANNs, object detection, semantic segmentation)
Computer Vision
Deep learning libraries and frameworks like Tensorflow/keras/Pytorch
ML Ops
Python
TypeScript
Test Driven Development
We understand that not everyone will be familiar with the tech stack or will check all of the boxes above. We would still love for you to apply and we will provide support if required!
What are some challenges?
You’ll need to know a bit about a bunch of different things. We don’t expect you to be an expert in coming up with the right ML technique to use for a given problem, but we do expect you to be able to pick up how to best help train, use, deploy, and maintain it. Most of Mappedin’s codebase is written in TypeScript, but the ML is done in Python, so you will end up using both languages, and the more you can push to TypeScript the more the rest of the Dev team can contribute.
Mappedin moves fast and we sometimes change directions. We can’t always wait for all the information before we try something. If you want us to guarantee exactly what you’ll be working on three months from now, we can’t give you that. On the other hand, there is a lot of high value work to do, and it won’t be boring.
Mappedin follows the Test Driven Development methodology to write code that is testable, tested, and only does what it needs to do. We don’t expect you to be an expert in TDD when you start, but we do expect you to become one. You also own the quality of your own work, and we expect you to prove that with your own integration and end to end tests.
Behind the scenes
We run an agile development process designed to give our developers as much uninterrupted development time as possible. Most days the only meeting you’re looking at is the morning standup.
We use a variety of technology and tools that currently include TypeScript, React, Jest, Three.js, Webpack, Node.js, Postgres, Kafka, MongoDB, and Docker.
There’s a lot of trust here at Mappedin. We are a REMOTE company. If you’re local, there will probably be a few days a week when you can expect other people to be in the office, but this role could also be fully remote. We work flexible hours, have a flexible vacation policy and work to provide the hardware or office equipment you require to unleash your potential. We will do what it takes to get things done if we said we would do it. We stay curious, challenge opinions, take risks, and learn from mistakes. We’re competitive and we like to win together. We want you to join us.
Txp4CKzBiT

About Very
Very is a fully distributed IoT technology firm led by expert problem-solvers to create efficient, scalable solutions that move commercial, industrial, and consumer IoT projects from pilot to production in record time.

We’ve built a collaborative, tight-knit team that thrives, whether we’re hanging out in person at our annual retreat or coordinating work across time zones. The results show that we’re doing something right — as we’ve won numerous workplace awards over the years. Most recently in 2021 we were certified as a Great Place to Work, and in 2022 we were listed again in Parity.org’s list of Best Companies for Women to Advance.

We believe that everything we build — and the people we build it with — has the potential to change the world. Our client list includes numerous well-known brands determined to leverage the power of IoT to drive material outcomes — such as Vizio, Peloton, Clear, iHeart Radio and Fellowes. Our goal, for each and every client we partner with, is to create high-value solutions through a collaborative and user-centered process. #LI-Remote

About This Role
As a Senior Data Scientist at Very, you will work with our Software, Hardware, and Product Design teams to build full-service solutions for our clients. We focus on building end-to-end hardware and software solutions that meet our clients’ business needs, and reliable machine learning systems are often a part of our offering. An ideal candidate will display technical expertise in machine learning and data science, as well as strong communication skills, and the ability to present ideas and results to audiences ranging in technical depth. Candidates should also have experience translating business problems into analytical solutions, working in interdisciplinary teams, and building ML models for production systems.

What You’ll Be Working On
At Very, there is a never-ending supply of variety to the types of projects we work on. However, it is critical to note that almost all of these projects are production systems. As such, the only consistent research component of this position will revolve around establishing a pattern of delivery that allows the team to implement full-scale applications leveraging machine learning in a fast, predictable manner.
You’ll spend 80-90% of your time working on products or platforms for one of our clients, and the other 10-20% of your time will be spent improving Very’s Data Science Practice. This will involve:
Working with other data scientists to continuously improve our delivery process for data science applications.
Working with our marketing team to generate high-quality content (blog posts, conference presentations)
Working with our sales team to close deals and build meaningful, well-scoped proposals for potential clients.
It is helpful to have familiarity with the following analytical approaches:
Predictive modeling and/or anomaly detection on multivariate time series data
State classification and prediction for geospatial time series data
Regression and classification using a variety of deep learning and ensemble tree-based methods
Clustering / segmentation
Dimensionality reduction or latent space representation
Classical statistical analysis and signal processing

Our Current Tooling
Our data science contracts typically involve building a greenfield API or greenfield product from the ground up. In the context of the data science and machine learning pipelines, we typically leverage:

Git, GitHub, CircleCI or GitHub Actions (CI/CD), pytest (TDD)
The standard SciPy Stack (Numpy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib)
SQL/Postgres
Docker
Jupyter notebooks for prototyping
Cloud architecture and resources for production systems. eg)
- AWS: Lambda, ECR/ECS, RDS, API Gateway, Batch, Sagemaker
- Azure: Functions, Container Registry/Instances, SQL Database [for PostgreSQL/MySQL], API Management, Machine Learning
- 3rd party: TimescaleDB
Serverless or Terraform for Infrastructure-as-Code
MLflow
PyTorch

On our full-service builds, we often reach for the following tools. Experience with them is not required, but any familiarity with these tools is a plus. Our build teams operate with a very high degree of collaboration, so you will definitely have run-ins with these stacks throughout your time here:

Python web development frameworks (Django, Flask)
React & React Native
Swift & Objective C
Ruby on Rails

As an IoT technology company our data science pipelines include “Things”. This will require you to build pipelines and deploy analytical models to hardware on the edge in addition to the cloud. This requires a deep collaboration with the design, software and hardware teams in the following environments:

Elixir, Phoenix, and Nerves
Embedded C and other lower level languages such as Rust
CI/CD including hardware and end-to-end testing and verification
Development Single-Board Computers such as RPi

Responsibilities
Work with stakeholders (clients, sales, engineers & designers) to define Statements Of Work (SOW)
- Communicate how data science can deliver value to the client
- Estimate quantity of work required to unlock this value
- Identify related assumptions, risks and dependencies
Take ownership of the data science components and related systems to ensure project success
- Architect, build and deploy reliable end-to-end data and ML pipelines into production
- Ensure the highest level of testing across the full data pipeline and operating envelope
- Execute and document all algorithm verification testing for certification
- Build and nurture strong relationships with clients, understand their perspective and walk them through the data science value chain
- Facilitate complex conversations to achieve alignment to drive positive outcomes
Continue to expand and evolve the Data Science (DS) practice at Very
- Provide technical guidance to DS and non-DS team members
- Pairs with mid team members to develop their skills and deliver on projects
- Continually learn, share and refine your DS skills and knowledge
- Establish and enact DataOps and MLOps best practices

Qualifications
Required
Bachelor degree in Data Science related field
3+ years of related experience
- Deployed statistical, ML or other analytical models to production
- Collaborated with hardware and software engineers
- Exposure to real-time signal processing
Strong written and spoken communication skills in English
Experience in and commitment to Agile development or Agile Data Science
Proficient in analytical framing
- Breaking down solutions into “thin vertical slices” of work
- Guiding interdisciplinary team to successfully estimate and execute these slices
Deep understanding of all four types analytics (Descriptive, Diagnostic, Predictive & Prescriptive)
- Translating desired client outcomes to the appropriate type
- Understanding the data requirements and techniques to achieve each type
Experience using a cloud computing platform like AWS, GCP, or Azure
Proficient Python development skills related to Data Science
- Object-Oriented Programming
- Automated testing, code coverage, model building & evaluation
- SciPy Stack, Scikit-learn, Tensorflow or PyTorch
- GitHub CI/CD best practices
Strong command of at least one other programming language
Comfortable developing Linux and light administration

Nice-to-have
Master’s degree in Data Science related field
5+ years of related experience
- Experience with connected devices
Proficient in embedded real-time signal processing
AWS Associate level certification
Experience developing in, compiling and deploying low level software
- C++, Embedded C or Rust preferred
Familiarity with Elixir, Phoenix, and Nerves
Hands on experience with Single-Board Computers such as RPi

Compensation
We believe in a fair compensation structure and use a transparent Delivery Matrix.

Base Compensation
Between CAD $140,625 and $173,400 per year, commiserate with experience.

Variable Compensation
up to 15% in the first year

We also offer world-class perks:
Extended Health Care Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision)
Paid Parental Leave
Life Insurance / AD+D
- Registered Retirement Service Plan RRSP = 25% / Match- $1 CAD for every $4 CAD contributed.
- Continuing Education Stipend - After 1 year of Employment (USD $3000/ year for learning and 100% of the costs if you’re speaking at an event)
Home Office Stipend (USD $1000 per year for your workstation/office)
USD $190/mo Monthly Communications Stipend (Can be used towards Cell Phone Data Plan, WiFi Plan, VOIP, VPN)
PTO / Sick Time
Variable Compensation based on performance
MacBook Pro (Provided)

Why Work for Very
You are more than your job title. At Very, we prioritize talent development and professional growth with a human-first approach that caters to the unique goals each individual brings to the team.

Our core value, Invest in Our People, looks like collaborating with a cohort of talented people on a mission to get better every single day. It feels like working for a company that invests in you. And it means finding alignment with your career goals to get you where you want to be.
How do we bring our priorities to life? Of course we offer the typical world-class perks you would expect. Additionally, as a remote-first company (since 2011), we provide stipends for home office, telephone, and internet. Professional development funds and generous parental leave are also some of the benefits you can expect.

But a healthy company culture isn't just about perks. It's about creating an environment where our employees can thrive. Our work is fueled by smart, creative people whose lives are enriched by our experiences together. We learn together, we grow together, and we play together. Despite working across more than half a dozen countries, our teams connect regularly for work and for fun - on Slack, Zoom, and during an annual retreat. We’ve been remote-first from the beginning, so we know well what it takes to maintain a strong culture. #LI-Remote

IMPORTANT:
1. This job is to work for a US company. An advanced level of English is a must. Please refrain from applying if this is not your case.
2. This job is remote but if you’re located in the province of Quebec, we cannot accept your application. This is due to Quebec’s labor laws. #LI-Remote

3. The region/country on the post's title is not related to the location of the clients you'll be serving. It's a reference to the current residence of the applicant! All of Very's clients are North America-based.
Interviewing for a new company is a serious time commitment for all parties involved. Please take the time to read this and consider if we would be a good fit. No contractors or agencies. Seriously.

Charger Logistics is a world class asset-based carrier. We specialize in delivering assets, on time and on budget. With the diverse fleet of equipment, we can handle a range of freight, including dedicated loads, specialized hauls, temperature-controlled goods and HAZMAT cargo.
Charger logistics invests time and support into its employees to provide them with the room to learn and grow their expertise and work their way up. We are entrepreneurial-minded organization that welcomes and support individual idea and strategies. We are currently expanding and looking to add a motivated individual to our team based out of our Brampton office.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with business partners to develop innovative solutions to meet objectives utilizing cutting edge techniques and tools.
Effectively communicate the analytics approach and how it will meet and address objectives to business partners.
Advocate and educate on the value of data-driven decision making; focus on the “how and why” of solutioning.
Lead analytic approaches; integrate solutions collaboratively into applications and tools with data engineers, business leads, analysts and developers.
Create repeatable, interpretable, dynamic and scalable models that are seamlessly incorporated into analytic data products.
Engineer features by using your business acumen to find new ways to combine disparate internal and external data sources.
Share your passion for Data Science with the broader enterprise community; identify and develop long-term processes, frameworks, tools, methods and standards.
Collaborate, coach, and learn with a growing team of experienced Data Scientists.
Stay connected with external sources of ideas through conferences and community engagements
Requirements:
Bachelors Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or related field.
4+ years of Data Science and Machine Learning experience required.
Experience working with AWS tools like Sage maker is a plus.
Proficiency in Python or R. Ability to write complex SQL queries.

Experience on Cloud Data Warehouses (Snowflake Data Cloud, Google BigQuery, DataBricks Lakehouse, Azure Synapse).

Streaming Data Ingestion and Analytics (Amazon Kinesis, Apache Kafka)

Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to understand business partner needs and deliver solutions
Bias for action, with the ability to deliver outstanding results through task prioritization and time management.

Job Title: Team Lead, Decision Scientist for Cancer Screening Analytics
Job Description:
Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity.
The Team Lead, Decision Scientist plays a key role in leading the delivery of analytics products to support the Ontario’s organized cancer screening programs. This role will partner with other screening teams, scientific and clinical leads to ensure the success of cancer screening programs through robust analytics and insights.
The Team Lead is responsible for supporting the Manager, Cancer Screening Analytics in delivering the analytics plans within screening programs. As part of this role, the Team Lead acts as the lead support to the Manager in resource utilization and developing plans and deliverables and interacting with key internal/ external stakeholders. The Team Lead acts on the Manager behalf in his/her absence.
Here is what you will be doing:
Technical Leadership
Responsible for the successful deliverables of cancer screening analytics products, including reports, key findings, training materials and data requests
Consults and well versed in cancer screening programs
Up-to-date knowledge of the cancer screening data, indicator methodology and report requirements to successfully implement the analytics projects
Leads data quality assurance procedures to ensure the high quality of analytics
Operational Planning
Works with the Manager to define objectives and standards, prioritize key activities, assign accountabilities and develops deliverables as part of the analytics plan
Develops a detailed analytics plan which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project
Supports identification and development of new analytics products
Project Management
Provides the support required by the Manager to ensure the analytics project objectives are met according to set standards and within the prescribed timelines; monitors and adjusts analytics work plans to accommodate the change in work priorities
Acts within a project as a contributor who oversees day-to-day operations of the planning, implementation and tracking of an analytics project
Identifies improvement opportunities and escalates key issues/risks to the Manager; proposes and executes solutions to address challenges or mitigate risks
Supports the Manager in engaging the required internal and external stakeholders
Managerial Leadership
Manages cancer screening analytics staff, including setting expectations; allocating work; overseeing and ensuring the quality of outputs; scheduling and prioritizing workloads
Trains and mentors staff while providing development opportunities for staff
Provides the Manager with performance feedback of staff resources
Provides full scope of leadership including hiring, termination, and performance review
Supervises team members in a formal capacity by providing leadership and guidance on day-to-day analytics activities
Provides input to the Manager on recruitment, performance management, and training and development
Here is what you will need to be successful:
Education and Experience
Master’s degree in biostatistics, statistics, health sciences, public health, health informatics, epidemiology, information management or recognized equivalent
Minimum 5 years of health data analysis experience
Minimum 2 years of management experience
Knowledge and Skills
Proven knowledge of data analysis techniques, statistical methodologies, quality management philosophy, and experimental design
Proficient in Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive)
Advanced SAS programing and experience with SAS macro and SQL is required
Strong knowledge of reporting requirements and database management principles
Familiarity with CIHI DAD and NACRS, OHIP and other healthcare datasets an asset
Strong analytic, critical thinking, and problem-solving capability with excellent attention to detail
Demonstrate analytic experience and creation of information products for a variety of audience
Highly motivated individual, creative, self-starter with proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage competing demands
Excellent skills in communications and presenting materials through verbal, written, or graphical techniques
Strong interpersonal, facilitation and leadership skills and the ability to work within a cross functional team including staff as well as internal and external stakeholders
Familiarity with cancer screening or cancer in Canada would be an asset
Employment Type: Permanent full-time
Paygrade and Zone: 6B
Location: Toronto, Ontario (currently hybrid; subject to change). All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.
Internal Application Deadline Date: December 2, 2022
Ontario Health encourages applications from candidates who are First Nations, Métis, Inuit, and urban Indigenous; Francophone; Black and racialized; members of 2SLGBTQIA+ communities; trans and nonbinary; and disabled.
We encourage applicants with accessibility needs to notify us if they have any accommodation needs in the application and/or interview process.
Note: As part of the initial recruitment screening process, applicants must confirm that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If applicants are not fully vaccinated, they will be required to identify any accommodation needs pursuant to a protected ground under the Code. Applicants who identify an accommodation need will be required to provide supporting documentation with respect to their need for accommodation when requested by Ontario Health. If no such accommodation is identified, the applicant will not be eligible to proceed through the recruitment process.

Job Title: (CAN) Analyst, Business Systems and Analytics – Direct Store Delivery (12 month contract)
Job Description:
Job Type: Temporary (Fixed Term)
Schedule: Morning, afternoons, evenings, nights
Position Summary...
The Analyst, Business Systems and Analytics – Direct Store Delivery will report to the Manager, Direct Store Delivery and will work closely with a team of Analysts to provide ongoing data support for the DOME Project. After the launch of DOME, this role will be responsible for assisting with the ongoing enhancements and maintenance of the system. This role builds out the entire tableau portfolio for the DSD program and will also provide analytics to the Walmart freight program and tie reporting, analysis, and results to the original objects.
What you'll do...
1. Project Management: work with competing priorities and tight deadlines, while overseeing a long-term project timeline and hitting milestones. Focus on the day-to-day task such as data cleansing, verifying, and user testing.
2. Schedule/systems/database/tool development: support with the development process of Project DOME, reflecting user needs in the product and responsible for future enhancements. Once the model is completed, the Analyst will support with ongoing maintenance and enhancements to the code.
3. Data analytics: extract reliable data from various data sources, including the Scheduler, WTMS, Helios, and CDL, to support Project DOME and help the business identify pain points. Individual will also be responsible for the build and maintenance of all the tableau reporting and business analytics that get shared with cross-functional business stakeholders. Responsible for producing analytics to optimize scheduling between stores and DSD suppliers. Analyst will be required to consolidate data and taking into consideration project parameters (zoning, municipality restriction bylaws).
4. Data science: proficient in data mining, data engineering, coding (including, but not limited to, Python, Hadoop, SQL, VBA, R, Excel). Pulling data from shared data warehouses, LSS database, Helios, FourKites.
5. Technical communications: work with technical and non-technical teams and communicate complex topics in a simple, concise manner to both audiences. Take data and articulate it into tableaus for use by business leaders, suppliers, internal stakeholders (merchants, SC, Replenishment, store operations).
6. Business judgement: provide adhoc analyses for business partners to establish and align on realistic expectations.
7. Design thinking: create innovative business solutions that address business needs with a seamless user experience that works today and tomorrow.

Age – 18 or older
Preferred Qualifications...
Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.
Walmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.

6800 MARITZ DRIVE, MISSISSAUGA, ON L5W 1W2, Canada

Job Title: Machine Learning Scientist and Software Developer
Job Description:
Title:
Machine Learning Scientist and Software Developer
Description:
We are looking for a software-oriented scientist or science-oriented software developer who wants to get a wide range of experience, and loves learning about physics, materials, chemistry, polymers, and electronics through a hands-on approach. This individual should:
Thrive working in a small, fast-paced team, leading the machine learning and software projects on the team, and making substantial contributions to the success of their projects
Be a generalist who can quickly learn and is willing and able to dive deep when necessary, specializing in specific topics as required
Be able to take a step back and manage a wide variety of tasks across different disciplines
Be good at collaborating with research scientists, engineers and specialists across different disciplines to drive cross-functional project development
Be a competent software developer who can maintain an existing (documented!) repository
Have a strong familiarity both with deep learning pipelines and software simulation of physical systems
Be comfortable working through problems and figuring things out with minimal supervision
Have familiarity with molecular structures, general chemistry, and basic physics
At Halion you will play an integral role in R&D and product development, ranging from material discovery to developing tools from physics simulations to project management applications.
We're a startup, so we're pretty relaxed about working hours, dress code, etc. We have heard that some candidates think "this sounds like a great place to work but there's no way I'm qualified..." - we are looking for good people, not just good experience! If your skills roughly align with what we've listed below, and you like the cut of our jib, give it a shot.
Perks
Employee benefits program (dental, vision, etc.)
Free coffee!
Flexible work hours
Control over your own project with a large impact on the final product
Responsibilities:
Maintaining and extending an existing code repository
Developing a deep learning pipeline using an existing project as a starting point, using cloud resources as well as on-site resources with the aim of improving the performance, accuracy and efficiency of quantum chemistry calculations and their application in advanced materials science
Developing code to work with existing datasets, and to create and work with new custom datasets
Interfacing with scientists and engineers to determine and satisfy project requirements
Design experiments; collect, analyze and interpret data; drive technical problem solving
Responsibly handling and working with sensitive and confidential information
Developing and running physics simulations using a variety of tools
Prototyping various software tools for other teams in the company to use
Programming microcontrollers to interface with prototypes as well as other electronic devices in order to meet technical specifications
Deep dive into literature to test, validate, and improve existing procedures and to develop new ones
Write research papers, abstracts, technical reports and SOPs
Effectively communicate project updates, difficulties and plans to team members
Train co-op students, contractors or other personnel; may supervise interns
Minimum qualifications:
BS or BASc in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, Computational Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, related field, or equivalent practical experience
Able to legally work in Canada
Competent Python developer - expert level not required, knowledge of algorithms not required, but you will be asked to code a few simple Python programs in an interview setting, and you may be asked to do a take-home development assignment
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills are required
Assets:
Ability to manage multiple complex projects and changing priorities, make sound decisions under pressure, and work effectively in a team environment
Ability to rapidly learn new systems and procedures
Experience working on challenging projects in a research environment. Ability to learn from failure and move on quickly to new strategies
Experience with Unix/Linux and HPC environments
Experience working with virtual environments, especially conda/miniconda
2+ years of professional experience building and deploying deep learning solutions
Experience with various machine learning frameworks, i.e. Tensorflow or Pytorch
Knowledge of Python is a requirement, other languages are a bonus
A link to your personal public git repository, or your open source contributions
Personal projects of any flavour: software, hardware, humanities, etc.
Experience with active, continuous, or transfer learning
Basic knowledge of chemistry, organic chemistry, electrostatics, and the physics of materials and molecules
Organization skills and the ability to use project management tools
Familiarity with standard operations and concepts within linear algebra
Good ability to visualize and manipulate 3D objects in your mind
Ability to travel internationally up to 6 weeks/yr.
Experience with electronics projects
Instructions to apply:
Do you want to be the very best [candidate], like no-one ever was? If so, please demonstrate the following in your cover letter and resume:
You have a bias for action (but you think before you act).
You enjoy working on personal projects not related to work (but you know how to manage your priorities).
You like technology - past, present and future.
You love learning new things, do so quickly, and can easily connect concepts from different fields.
You will use the word juxtaposition as naturally as possible in your application, so I know that you read this.
You like to solve problems, especially using your creativity and imagination.
You thrive in ambiguous environments that enable you to be creative.
Failure does not deter you from trying harder but you also know when to give up.
You derive your self worth from the effort you put in, and not from your successes or failures.
You are constantly working to experiment and improve yourself, because nobody is perfect.
An enjoyment of Star Wars is an asset. Bonus points if you can make a good Wookiee sound.
Our interview process will include up to 1 phone screen, 3 interviews, a short take-home assignment, and reference checks where applicable.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $65,000.00-$85,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Casual dress
Commuter benefits
Company events
Dental care
Disability insurance
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
Flextime
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Stock options
Vision care
Work from home
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Ability to commute/relocate:
Kitchener, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)
Experience:
machine learning: 2 years (preferred)
Python development: 2 years (preferred)
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Kitchener, ON

Job Description :
About Us

Amica Senior Lifestyles is setting a new standard for senior living in Canada by combining unparalleled premium hospitality and amenities with expert care and support to deliver a personalized senior living experience. Committed to enriching the lives of seniors now and as their needs change, Amica offers Independent Living (IL), Assisted Living (AL) and Memory Care (MC) lifestyle options. Established in 1996, the company owns and operates 33 residences in British Columbia, Alberta and Ontario, with plans to continue expansion in select markets.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Director, Research & Development Analytics, we are looking for an individual who is passionate about applying machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to support our investment strategy at Amica Senior Lifestyles. This individual will be working closely with cross-functional partners to research data science models and oversee end-to-end implementation of the models into production systems. Working with teams of diverse skillsets and backgrounds, lead research projects to solve the most difficult and convoluted problems an investment team has while taking additional responsibility of mentoring junior team members. With the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Data & Analytics, to continued growth and development with Amica Senior Lifestyles.

What you will be doing
Build and execute a long-term roadmap of elevating data science capabilities within Amica by researching, piloting, and introducing leading edge data technologies and products
Effectively plan and manage analytics projects, leading small technical teams
Define data science projects end to end including identifying opportunities, defining the problem, building proof of concepts, and deploying solutions to production
Conduct data mining, on assorted data sources, to extract insights and generate hypotheses for model development & testing
Perform data pre-processing, data integrity, feature selection, model selection analysis and identify opportunities to improve existing data models and techniques
Develop machine learning models and support the management of models throughout the model lifecycle, produce reusable machine learning pipelines while building models
Gain and maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and acquire ability to effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes
Guide and mentor data analysts in improving data quality and availability; help them create rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis
Balance multiple, competing priorities effectively, track documentation and deliverables in an organized manner
Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals

What you will bring

Master’s degree or PhD/Research, ideally in a discipline such as
Business Analytics / Business Intelligence
Computer Science,
Statistics,
Applied Science/ Engineering,
or related area
An understanding of data-driven technology with 5+ years’ experience in data and analytics environments
Solid experience working with complex datasets and building research-based data models
Strong foundation in supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning techniques, Feature Engineering, Classification, Clustering, Segmentation, NLP, Time Series Analysis and Demand Forecasting etc.
Knowledge of and experience with relational databases (SQL, PostgreSQL etc.)
Strong scripting and programming skills in Python /R
Excellent communication and presentation skills with fluency in translating business questions into actionable requirements
Proven team-management experience strongly preferred
Advanced MS Office user, ability to create powerful presentations and write high-quality executive reports
Quick learner, ability to work well in a team, and strong problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail and an ability to multi-task on simultaneous projects under tight deadlines

What you can expect from us

A diverse and inclusive environment where individual differences are celebrated, and you’re encouraged to be your best self
A collaborative environment where we work together to succeed as a team
Learning opportunities to help you grow and support for professional development and designations
Comprehensive benefit package including RRSP matching
Office is centrally located in the financial district, on the PATH and the TTC subway line, and provides easy access to downtown amenities
Participation in Amica’s Flex or Hybrid work model providing team members the opportunity to work a combination of days both in office and remotely

At Amica Senior Lifestyles we are passionate about working together in a supportive and inclusive environment that fosters innovation and turns ideas into action. We remain committed to creating workplaces that reflect the communities in which we operate. We are actively seeking applicants from all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, Black, Indigenous, racialized people, and persons with disabilities and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for our positions.

Amica Senior Lifestyles recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, team members and visitors from COVID-19. Effective October 2021, a condition of employment is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.
Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Job Title: SENIOR MANAGER, DATA & ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) (Toronto, Hybrid)
Job Description:
Location: Pickering, ON, CA, L1W 3J2
Req ID: 40802
BE THE GENERATION to help build a brighter tomorrow.
Every generation has a challenge that defines them. At OPG, we are calling on all innovators, disruptors, thought leaders and change-makers. Join us as we electrify life in one generation and build a sustainable future powered by our electricity, our ideas, and our people.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, data science, advanced analytics, business intelligence, data, artificial intelligence, computer science or business.
Five plus years of progressive experience in IT strategy, governance, data, advanced analytics, business, or artificial intelligence.
Strong interpersonal skills; experience building and maintaining productive relationships and partnerships across the business with various stakeholders internally and externally, technical and non-technical.
Excellent presentation skills, with strong verbal/written communication skills; ability to build strategic and impactful communications and present to senior and executive management.
Experience working with big data environment; knowledge of data management tools, data transformation, technical analytics, data policies and procedures.
Experience leading digital transformations; with the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) platforms and applications and machine learning (ML) solutions.
Demonstrated experience in taking a project from strategy to implementation; previous consulting experience successfully leading and advising cross-function, indirect teams of resources to execute high-impact projects.
Previous management experience effectively leading, influencing and motivating a team of technical professionals.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Understanding of applications, databases, data marts and data lakes.
Naturally curious, strong problem solver; ability to synthesize complex problems into clear next steps and recommendations.
Experience designing, executing, and continuously improving business processes in a complex and challenging business environment.
Strong business and financial acumen; extensive knowledge and understanding of business financials, budgets, legal concepts, commercial contracts, and laws.
Experience working in/for/on behalf of highly regulated and complex industries/organizations.

WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

ABOUT THE ROLE: As part of the CIO, reporting to the Director, Enterprise Digital Technology, you will deliver strategic initiatives to inform and engage staff, leaders, and key stakeholders; to advance awareness, and understanding of risks, opportunities with data and artificial intelligence; leveraging innovative technology and IT solutions to help advance OPG and its key strategic priorities.

You will also be responsible for building out and delivering OPG’s Data and AI strategy, building a team of professionals responsible for developing an environment that provides advice, internal consulting, and support to advance innovative technology capabilities. In this role, you will promote the company’s data and AI strategy and priorities, developing a data-driven decision culture while building technical capabilities across the CIO and the organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Data & AI Leadership: Develop and execute OPG’s Data and AI strategies and roadmaps, aligning technology priorities to strategic business growth, goals and objectives.
Thought Leadership & Business Advisory: Manage and grow an AI Center of Excellence, where the department provides expertise, consulting and advisory services while supporting the business need/project. Represent OPG with external stakeholders, speaking at conferences and events, and representing the CIO Data and AI business unit with staff and internal stakeholders.
Industry Best Practices: Actively monitor the market for trends and developments to prepare recommendations-experience directing data and AI processes, including developing, coordinating and recommending innovative approaches, processes, policies and procedures.
Data Analysis: Manage, monitor, and support the progress of various ongoing projects and initiatives exploring data analysis, from proof of concept, experimentation, and decision-making techniques.
Process Improvements: Develop innovative solutions and improve the efficiency of existing business processes, focusing on adding value and business benefits. Drive continuous improvement, curiosity, data literacy, and a data-driven, informed decision culture.
Project Management: In this role, you will manage a balanced portfolio of projects that span from disruptive initiatives to growth and innovative projects, ensuring each is prioritized and the continued cadence on each.
IT Governance: Support the establishment of standards, processes, and governance to support Data and AI capability within the CIO and across the business.
Financial Management: Assist with developing and managing the yearly budget to support the CIO, and manage the assigned budget for the Data and AI business unit.
Team Development & Management: Provide strategic direction, develop and supervise a team of technical resources (approx. four direct reports), ensuring strong performance. Develop through mentorship, role modelling and real-time guidance. At the same time, continuing to build engagement and curiosity.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU

This is an exciting opportunity to work in an environment where you will contribute to Ontario Power Generation’s continued growth and success in generating clean, safe, reliable, low-cost power sustainably. Here’s why OPG might be the ideal workplace for you:
Have an active role in helping advance critical energy projects that will make a meaningful difference in the fight against climate change.
OPG cares about the safety and well-being of our employees. It is our utmost priority.
We offer a supportive work environment where you can be your best daily.
Learn from the best; be part of an industry-leading innovative organization where you have access to opportunities across a diverse mix of work in the energy sector.
Competitive total rewards package with retirement savings of a defined benefit pension plan.
Be part of a growing industry where the demand for our power will only grow in importance as we further electrify the economy.
Flexible work arrangement and hybrid working environment.
Exceptional range of opportunities to stretch, advance and develop.
Work for a business that cares and is committed to building a sustainable future. Our public commitments help hold us accountable for OPG’s climate change plan, Our Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy, and Our Reconciliation Action Plan.
Participate and volunteer in some of the many ways OPG gives back to the communities where we operate.
Be part of making a difference in the lives of fellow Ontarians and Canadians. Electricity is vital to the province, and OPG's clean electricity is helping decarbonize other sectors.

OUR PROMISE TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION: OPG is committed to accelerating equity, celebrating diversity, and fostering a culture of inclusion where all employees are valued, respected and supported. Appropriate arrangements can be made if you require accommodation during the application or interview process. If you need information in an alternative format, please get in touch with mailto:AODA@opg.com

NEW CAMPUS: In 2025, (OPG) is establishing a new corporate headquarters in Durham Region. The new campus will provide a cutting-edge work environment that fosters collaboration and innovation.

ABOUT ONTARIO POWER GENERATION (OPG): We continue to set the bar for environmental protection, community involvement and economic impact - all while safely keeping the lights on. Now we've set out sights on https://www.opg.com/climate-change/ and a catalyst to help the economies where we operate achieve net-zero by 2050.

OPG operates a https://www.opg.com/powering-ontario/our-generation/, including; nuclear, hydroelectric, biomass, natural gas, and solar. We are also a clean-tech leader and innovator, offering challenging and unique work opportunities. Help us use our power to change the world.

Status: Regular Full Time
Working Conditions: Hybrid Working Environment
Education Level: University Degree
Location: 700 University Ave, Toronto, ON
Shifts(s): Days
Travel: Yes- 10%
Deadline to Apply: Sunday, December 11th, 2022.

OPG thanks all those who apply; however, only candidates considered for an interview will be contacted.
.

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

The Data Scientist will join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics team within Data & Technology that applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable business-first solutions for sustainable growth at OMERS. The Data Scientist will work alongside analytics specialists on their team and partner with data and analytics specialists within businesses and corporate functions to design, develop, implement and scale advanced solutions following best practices to drive measurable business outcomes.

Reporting to the Director of Enterprise Data Science, you will work closely with our Businesses, Corporate Functions, Enterprise Architecture, Business Relationship Management, Infrastructure and Enterprise Service Management, Cyber, Data Engineering, Data Governance and Analytics Strategy teams to deploy new capabilities following leading product management and AI system methodologies. You will develop and nurture strong relationships with partners in a variety of different business units across our global portfolio, building an understanding of their needs and how to apply data, analytics and AI techniques to increase scale and operational efficiency, enhance self-service capabilities and elevate the understanding & application of these capabilities across the company.

The Data Scientist will partner with internal stakeholders and external partners to build out AI systems and deliver data analytics projects within set timelines. They meet objectives and focus on priorities which drive the successful operation of this Department and ensures alignment with OMERS business and technology strategy.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Fostering strong relationships among cross-functional teams and facilitating decision making within multi-level audiences. Applying a system thinking approach to lead execution of data, analytics and AI initiatives quickly and in collaboration with other teams
Driving the implementation of corporate/strategic objectives via AI/ML driven projects and seeing opportunities
Building ML projects from experiments and hands-on solutioning through to production
Implementing model tracking, updating, and auto-train capabilities in addition to accounting for drift and imbalance
Building and maintaining NLP models using state of the art techniques like transformers and seq2seq for the purposes of classification, sentiment analysis, entity extraction, and more
Driving analytics innovation by posing open ended questions, exploring new ideas, recommending the appropriate techniques to solve challenging business problems and rapid prototyping
Developing, deploying, and operationalizing data science products along with the supporting integrated tools and processes, including but not limited to security, performance, scalability, and extendibility
Hands on creation and oversight of analytical models, conducting model training, validation, testing, integrated reconciliations and ongoing data and model integrity maintenance
Remaining on the “leading edge” of emerging data, analytics and AI technologies and techniques to identify and implement novel tools and techniques and their application to new use cases and deployment opportunities
Driving a culture of innovation and AI by taking initiatives for activities such as lunch and learns, hackathons, paper readouts, etc.

To succeed in this role, you have:
A undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or any other quantitative field
Minimum five (5) years’ experience working in a data science/ Machine Learning environment
1-3+ years of experience leading and delivering enterprise-scale data science/ML projects and facilitating collaboration across teams
A proven grasp of the practical and theoretical aspects of statistical and deep learning such as data structures, algorithms, gradient descent, probability theory, linear algebra, calculus, hypothesis testing, and more
Experience building scalable and automated ML pipelines with strong Python programming skills
Natural language computing/understanding experience including but not limited to source data extraction, structuring, named entity extraction, sentiment analysis, topic modelling, and more
Experience with framework such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, MxNet and the sci-kit learn library
Proficiency with git is a must
Experience implementing pre-built models at scale along with retraining and implementing a custom deep-learning architecture is a strong plus
Experience working in the financial sector- ideally banks or investment firms, is an asset
Experience within Pensions, Investments and Commercial Real Estate sectors are an asset
Hands-on experience with big data systems such as Spark, Hadoop, Hive and ideally cloud technologies such as Azure Data Factory, AzureML, Azure Synapse, Google Fusion, Google BigQuery, AWS SageMaker, and others
Experience in using external/alternative data, data modeling, data architecture, data engineering, insight generation, data visualization, feature engineering and AI systems development & optimization
A passion around learning new technologies and analytical techniques with a track record of acting on this in prior roles and in their free time through projects, partnerships, mentoring and hackathons
Demonstrated experience as a leader in creatively addressing unique or ambiguous situations and motivating teams and delivering multiple projects simultaneously serving multiple stakeholders
The ability to build relationships and facilitate across a diverse group of stakeholders in several different business units
Demonstrated experience applying product management, design thinking and human centered design
Polished written and verbal communication and presentation skills targeted at all levels of the organization

Our story:
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

Referred applicants should not apply directly to this role.

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Planning and Analytics, this role is accountable to help develop and drive analytic reporting tools and capabilities to support the Home & Entertainment Merchandising team. You will support strategic initiatives and drive business performance through the development of analytical and reporting tools, lead data driven projects and connect the dots between data insights and business users. You will derive practical insights and make recommendations to support business strategy by compiling and analyzing internal, competitive and industry data. If you succeed at the intersection of data and solving business problems, and are customer driven, this is the place for you.
What you’ll do
Analyze data and recommend insights to solve business problems or identify new opportunities
Extract data from databases, review, and prepare data for analysis using SQL and/or Python
Design, build, and publish various reports to provide insights and enable strategic business decisions
Build algorithms and tools to achieve business goals and improve existing processes
Conduct statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to improve forecasting, targeting, and performance measurement
Build statistical, descriptive, and predictive models to support experimentation that are easily understood and replicated
Actively identify and execute initiatives to improve process and data infrastructure
Support the development and operations of data products working collaboratively with various teams across the enterprise
Demonstrate CORE values by elevating and advocating for peer group

What you’ll need
University Degree (preferably Masters) in Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science
In-depth working experience in Python & advanced SQL data extraction and manipulation tools
Strong Excel fundamentals is required, with modeling skills an asset
Previous experience in retail operations and/or merchandising is an asset
Experience with cloud environment; GCP preferred
Ability to analyze large amounts of data to bring forward key takeaways into an easy-to-read framework
Superior analytical and conceptual thinking skills; to not only manipulate but also derive meaningful interpretations from data
Ability to work with and explore ambiguous data
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to story-tell with data and collaborate with a variety of stakeholders
Detail oriented and strong time management skills
Ability to take the initiative, multi-task, and work in a fast-paced environment
Capability to liaise with all levels across the enterprise on projects and ad-hoc requests

· Together with the BI Manager and IT / Data team, you collaborate on the design of BI/BW data models, data store objects, and information stores to sustain current and future needs

· You prepare required reporting suite documentation including (but not limited to): functional specifications, design documents, testing documents (including use cases) and product release notes.

What you bring to the role:
· A Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Data Science or related field
· 5+ years of experience design/implementation BI report development/dashboard & visualization solutions, incorporating best practices
· Experience with data visualization tools including Qlik view/Qlick Sense, PowerBI and/or other visualization methodologies & best practices
· Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills
· Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced team environment
· You have solid BI analytics and dashboard development knowledge. Supply Chain or Retail Operations experience a plus.
Who you are:

· You have the courage to think differently about how things get done to continuously improve and deliver even better results every day.
· The safety, health, and well-being of yourself and your team, is your first priority.

· When making decisions, you consider relevant stakeholders and engage those who can add value to the process.
· You are nimble in your approach and prioritize with focus on what adds value to the stakeholders and customers.
· Experience configuring and enhancing standard data sources.
· Working knowledge of Scale WMS, SAP WMS, and TMS platforms preferred.
