A degree in an analytical or quantitative field such as computer science, applied mathematics/statistics, engineering, physics, computational chemistry, etc
1-2 years work experience in health analytics and machine learning
Strong background in statistical analysis methods such as Regression, Classification, Clustering, and Neural Networks
Extensive experience using Databases, SQL, Python, Scikit-learn, and Pandas
Good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate complex ideas in a concise manner
Experience using collaborative coding and version control (GitHub, GitLab)
A passion for solving problems in healthcare using analytics and machine learning tools
Nice to have:
Solid understanding of Graph Neural Networks, NLP, time-series forecasting, Spark pipelines
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Plotly, Tableau, and/or Seaborn
Familiarity with GCP, Confluence, JIRA, MLflow, or similar tools

Job Title: Team Lead, Decision Scientist for Cancer Screening Analytics
Job Description:
Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity.
The Team Lead, Decision Scientist plays a key role in leading the delivery of analytics products to support the Ontario’s organized cancer screening programs. This role will partner with other screening teams, scientific and clinical leads to ensure the success of cancer screening programs through robust analytics and insights.
The Team Lead is responsible for supporting the Manager, Cancer Screening Analytics in delivering the analytics plans within screening programs. As part of this role, the Team Lead acts as the lead support to the Manager in resource utilization and developing plans and deliverables and interacting with key internal/ external stakeholders. The Team Lead acts on the Manager behalf in his/her absence.
Here is what you will be doing:
Technical Leadership
Responsible for the successful deliverables of cancer screening analytics products, including reports, key findings, training materials and data requests
Consults and well versed in cancer screening programs
Up-to-date knowledge of the cancer screening data, indicator methodology and report requirements to successfully implement the analytics projects
Leads data quality assurance procedures to ensure the high quality of analytics
Operational Planning
Works with the Manager to define objectives and standards, prioritize key activities, assign accountabilities and develops deliverables as part of the analytics plan
Develops a detailed analytics plan which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project
Supports identification and development of new analytics products
Project Management
Provides the support required by the Manager to ensure the analytics project objectives are met according to set standards and within the prescribed timelines; monitors and adjusts analytics work plans to accommodate the change in work priorities
Acts within a project as a contributor who oversees day-to-day operations of the planning, implementation and tracking of an analytics project
Identifies improvement opportunities and escalates key issues/risks to the Manager; proposes and executes solutions to address challenges or mitigate risks
Supports the Manager in engaging the required internal and external stakeholders
Managerial Leadership
Manages cancer screening analytics staff, including setting expectations; allocating work; overseeing and ensuring the quality of outputs; scheduling and prioritizing workloads
Trains and mentors staff while providing development opportunities for staff
Provides the Manager with performance feedback of staff resources
Provides full scope of leadership including hiring, termination, and performance review
Supervises team members in a formal capacity by providing leadership and guidance on day-to-day analytics activities
Provides input to the Manager on recruitment, performance management, and training and development
Here is what you will need to be successful:
Education and Experience
Master’s degree in biostatistics, statistics, health sciences, public health, health informatics, epidemiology, information management or recognized equivalent
Minimum 5 years of health data analysis experience
Minimum 2 years of management experience
Knowledge and Skills
Proven knowledge of data analysis techniques, statistical methodologies, quality management philosophy, and experimental design
Proficient in Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive)
Advanced SAS programing and experience with SAS macro and SQL is required
Strong knowledge of reporting requirements and database management principles
Familiarity with CIHI DAD and NACRS, OHIP and other healthcare datasets an asset
Strong analytic, critical thinking, and problem-solving capability with excellent attention to detail
Demonstrate analytic experience and creation of information products for a variety of audience
Highly motivated individual, creative, self-starter with proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage competing demands
Excellent skills in communications and presenting materials through verbal, written, or graphical techniques
Strong interpersonal, facilitation and leadership skills and the ability to work within a cross functional team including staff as well as internal and external stakeholders
Familiarity with cancer screening or cancer in Canada would be an asset

Job Title: Data Scientist/Statistician - Software Defined Vehicle Analytic
Job Description:
Job Description

SDV is looking for a dedicated and passionate Data Scientist with an extensive applied statistics background who will become part of a newly formed data analytics team. The SDV Super Cruise analytics team is focused on providing analytical insights about Super Cruise usage to several internal customers across GM. It is a highly collaborative, driven, and bold organization that embraces innovation and challenges. This position will play a significant role in our SDV family. It requires extensive knowledge of applied statistics, specifically: create and identify meaningful actionable statistics based on business needs, ensure applied statistical analyses are unbiased, accurate and precise, and identify problems, solutions, and opportunities from data analyses. Typical work includes collaborating with data engineers and other data scientists on the team within the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) to complete analytical assignments. Additionally, you will act as a statistical mentor/consultant to others on the team.

So, if you have curiosity and initiative for deriving insights from data and generating impactful business value, and you have experience in statistics, mathematics, and/or data science we are looking for you! Come and join the team that is shaping the landscape in the automotive industry!

Requirements and Key Responsibilities
Advanced degree in statistics, mathematics, data science or a related technical field
Minimum 5+ years of work experience in applied statistics or analytics
Strong expertise with the following statistical methods: time series analysis, categorical data analysis, multivariate analysis, and clustering
Expertise visually charting and graphing data to convey a story
Experience creating and identifying meaningful actionable statistics based on business needs
Experience with machine learning (supervised or unsupervised), statistical modeling, and text mining to meet analytical objectives
Proficient with one or more data mining / predictive modeling tools such as Python and R, as well as proficiency in SQL
Analyze large complex structured and unstructured data sets
Communicate an unbiased story using analytical insight to influence decision making
Collaborate with data engineers to build data and model pipelines
Experience with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)
Work in a fast-paced agile environment to develop and deliver advanced analytics solutions
Cultivate an open and inclusive culture that supports learning and encourages collaboration
Ability to be strategic and tactical, with strong problem-solving abilities
Ability to independently manage high volume workload
Must be a self-starter and highly comfortable dealing with ambiguity
Continuous learning mindset - willingness to learn new skills and methods as needed

Experienced with the following is preferred:
Power BI
AZURE Cloud Computing Service
Software Telemetry data
Understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain
Experience working with distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and Machine Learning pipelines (Spark, DASK, Argo, etc.)
Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) certification

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

TD Description

Department Overview
What does TD stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and for almost every department, that begins with data.
As part of our Data and Analytics team, you'll be a fundamental part of crafting business processes enterprise-wide by analyzing vast amounts of past and present data.
TD's vision for the future? Tailored, customized banking products, services and experiences for every single customer. If you've been in business as long as we have, you know there's no such thing as one size fits all, and a diverse, inclusive Data Analytics team is a massive part of that future achievement.
Job Description
About this Role
You are eager to provide your burgeoning technical expertise as part of a team that takes on consistently complex projects across a wide range of business units. You are familiar with data functions including data modelling, visualization, data profiling, data origin and lineage, report design and more. You will employ these disciplines to help create data related solutions to drive business results. You thrive on positive feedback and use your specialized knowledge to implement feedback systems that evaluate your team's progress and create innovative new ways improve your overall performance.
We are looking for someone to work as part of a trailblazing team of data scientists who create groundbreaking analytical solutions that improve our core work enterprise wide.
As a Data Scientist I, these are the essential qualifications of this role:
Guide on mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the organization
Interpret the meaning of new strategic directions and set objectives and measurements
Implement monitoring and feedback systems to evaluate progress and identify ways of making continuous improvements
Capture and analyze information or data on current and future trends
Seek information on issues impacting the progress of organizational and process issues
Educate the organization on approaches, such as testing hypotheses and statistical validation of result
Help the organization understand the principles and the math behind the scientist process to drive organizational alignment
Translate up to date information into continuous improvement activities that enhance performance
Research organizational and professional trends, evaluate information sources, and collate and compare findings for bias, omission and accuracy, conduct objective analysis
Establish positive working relationships across multiple business and technology partners, program and project managers
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units

What You’ll Do
Acquire, clean and structure data from various sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Develop, prototype and test predictive algorithms.
Filter and "clean" data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and accurate code problems.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.

Who You’ll Work With

Meet us at the intersection of Cloud, Security Analytics & Network technologies. We are working on groundbreaking technologies that directly improve internet security through analytics. Work on massive structured, unstructured, transactional, and real-time data sets from a variety of sources to analyze customer usage patterns and provide actionable, intuitive, impactful insights using metrics, algorithms, and statistics.

Who You Are

Including but not limited to a graduate/upcoming graduate of a technical degree or certification program from a Technical Boot Camp, Apprenticeship, Community College or 4-Year University.
Self-starter with a passion for solving hard complex problems and background in security analytics domain.
Working knowledge of Snowflake, Vertex AI, AWS Sage Maker, Jupyter notebooks and other AI/ML toolset.
Strong experience in Python, cryptography & JavaScript.
You know how to work a problem from beginning to end with data science tools and techniques, including data manipulation (SQL, Hadoop, Spark etc.) and programming (R, Python, XML, JavaScript, or ETL) frameworks.
Experience with Relational & Non-Relational databases is desirable. Strong knowledge of and experience with data visualization with Kibana, Looker, Grafana or similar technologies.
Technical knowledge regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficient in queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Knowledge of Linux & Cisco network devices is desirable.
Able to legally live and work in the country for which you’re applying, without visa support or sponsorship.
Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

It's your time to Achieve, Excel and Succeed in this career building role

The Forest Carbon and Climate Services Branch (FCCSB) focuses on forest carbon and climate science, policy, and analysis to support implementation of the Ministry’s Climate Change mandate, including the Ministry’s Climate Change Strategy, CleanBC, and the Climate Change Preparedness and Adaptation Strategy. FCCSB is establishing the Future Forest Ecosystems Centre (FFEC) to develop long-term forecasts of climate-induced ecological stresses and related hazards. The focus of the FFEC is translation of research expertise into data and tools that can be used directly by planners and practitioners.

The Data Scientist is the lead computing and data analysis expert for the FFEC. The Data Scientist works closely with other FFEC scientists to build decision-support tools for managing climate change risks to ecosystems. This role also requires proactive engagement of scientific and policy experts in other branches and ministries. The position undertakes independent professional data analysis and represents the ministry at partner or stakeholder meetings.

This is your opportunity to live in one of the most beautiful regions in British Columbia and work for the BC Public Service. We offer a healthy work/life balance, excellent benefits and much more.

The Data Scientist will be a part of our Technology and Market Analysis team. This role will focus on developing and applying machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to support pricing models and other insights around carbon markets. They will work closely with other key internal stakeholders, to research data science models and oversee end-to-end implementation. The Data Scientist will lead research projects to solve the ongoing challenges while mentoring and supporting other team members.
Requirements of the Role
The Data Scientist will be responsible for but not limited to:
Define data science projects from start to finish, identifying opportunities, defining the problem, building a proof of concept, and deploying a data product to improve marketing, product development, or overall business strategies
Conduct data mining on customer, product, sales, assortment data sources for insights; generate hypotheses to test for opportunities
Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions and projects in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals.
Apply a wide range of statistical and quantitative analysis in practical and valuable ways
Design custom tools to optimize data mining, cleaning, validation and analysis tasks
Develop tools and testing models to ensure data accuracy
Use predictive modeling to optimize environmental financial unit pricing forecasts
Program and write maintainable and well-documented scripts/applications for process automation; produce reusable machine learning pipelines while model building
Connect with other teams to understand the go-to-market process, product lifecycle, and product/consumer strategy
Create rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources; communicate results to senior leadership
Propose solutions and strategies to business opportunities and challenges
So are you our next Data Scientist? You could be if you are a curious self-starter who is an insightful, results-orientated, and motivated professional with exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. You have a proven ability to conduct thorough analysis using multiple data sources, evaluate and present visual results in Tableau. The Data Scientist requires the ability to understand a concept from a broader perspective with strong problem-solving skills. You are adaptable and love working with people and teams from diverse skillsets and backgrounds, in a highly collaborative and often times remote working environment.
Experience, Education, and Designations:
Academic background in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Research, or a related field
Must have experience with Tableau and/or Python
Strong SQL and/or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Experience in at least one of the common data science toolkits
Demonstrated experience applying machine learning and data mining techniques
Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:
Strong problem solving and analytical skills including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization through Tableau
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including reports and presentations
Strong technical attitude – ability to turn business problems into analytical solution
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results
Ability to take on responsibilities and work with minimal supervision
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships
Communicates with kindness and has integrity
Ideally understands what carbon markets are and has passion for environmental issues

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Data Scientist
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
In this role as a Data Scientist, you will analyze, design, and implement data science/machine learning solutions using RBC’s enterprise suite of analytics tools. The group specializes in taking full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. Leveraging leading-edge technologies and capabilities, the group applies machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to help RBC understand the changing business environment, discover new growth opportunities and determine where business improvements can be made.
What will you do?
Work with business partners and stakeholders to understand the problem statement/business objective and accordingly develop machine learning algorithms to identify these complex threat scenarios that are able to evade traditional detection tools.
Prototype the algorithms for execution in the Hadoop environment, GPU and cloud environments.
Work with business stakeholders, internal and external QA to ensure that the final product is of the highest quality and is able to meet pre-defined business objects.
Collaborate with application development and data engineering team to deploy a scalable batch/real-time model to production.
Support the development of a proactive approach to threat detection and/or misuse identification.
Train and mentor junior employees when applicable.
Participate in Proof of Concept or Proof of Technology projects to evaluate cybersecurity technologies and platforms.
Operate third-party technologies to analyze security data and identify threats and misuse cases, and evaluate capabilities of those technologies.
Participate in the creation of detailed plans and accurate estimates towards the development, testing, and implementation of proactive threat detection capabilities.
Contribute to successful completion of projects by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:
A background in Computer Science, Computational Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Solid knowledge of general Machine Learning concepts both in theory and application and experience with advanced topics like Deep Learning, NLP, etc.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature and representation learning, and anomaly/outlier detection.
Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, R, Scala.
Experience with big data processing technologies like Spark.
Knowledge of Parallel Programming and High-Performance Computing.
Nice-to-have:
Knowledge of network and information security.
Knowledge of the Hadoop and GPU ecosystem.
Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: PyTorch, TensorFlow.
Ability to develop statistical tests and run controlled trials.
What’s in it for you?

The Data Analyst/Scientist (Co-op) is responsible for providing insightful reporting and data analytics that drive key performance indicators (KPIs) such as service resiliency, customer satisfaction, and service delivery improvements.
The Data Analyst/Scientist (Co-op) will ensure timely, accurate, and complete reporting of data, data analysis, and consultation on data improvements. Leveraging our business intelligence tools, the Data Analyst/Scientist will support the Cloud Service Quality Assurance Manager in the creation and maintenance of performance reports and dashboards. The analyst will be responsible for collecting, aggregating and helping analyze data to prepare reports, which may be in the form of visualizations such as graphs, charts and dashboards, detailing the information they’ve gathered.
This position is the bridge between the large amounts of data and the Quality leadership team, to support data-driven strategic and tactical decision-making and reporting. This position will also involve participation in other quality improvement initiatives, where the insights of the Data Analyst/Scientist will be a key contribution.

Coordinate with Quality and Operations teams to maintain and develop reporting needs through ERP, BI, and other relevant systems/tools; and
Conduct data mining and report generation in an environment where data is unstructured and oftentimes must be extracted from various systems.
Presentation of results of quantitative analysis that may include recommendations for process improvement.

Job Description
Manulife’s bold ambition is to become a digital, customer leader. As part of this ambition, we have made a significant investment in Advanced Analytics and AI capabilities. The goal of the Group Advanced Analytics & AI team is to research, build, and deliver cutting edge capabilities to better support our external customers as well as provide actionable insights to our internal corporate stakeholders.
NLP Centre of Excellence (CoE) is a part of advance analytics team at Manulife which specializes in development of machine learning and deep learning applications on variety of unstructured dataset, such as topic modeling using voice call transcripts, using a two-tower transformer model to do a semantic search in historical documents, using weak supervised learning to classify surveys, etc.
NLP CoE in Manulife is looking for a data scientist at an associate or mid senior level. This data scientist will play a key role in achieving this ambitious mission of the team. The successful candidate will have strong background in NLP and deep learning at academic or industry level, good communication skills, innovative mindset, and strong strategic and functional skills.
We are looking for someone with:
Master’s or Ph.D. in a quantitative discipline (Business Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, etc.).
1-3 years of experience in developing probabilistic models, deep learning and/or machine learning algorithms in the area of natural language processing.
Proficiency in languages used for querying, data processing, statistical analysis, model building, and monitoring, including Python and SQL.
Strong understanding of the foundation of machine learning algorithms, statistical methods, and natural language processing methods.
Comfort with visual art and design to turn statistical and computational analysis into user-friendly graphs, charts, and animations. Create insightful data visualizations (e.g., motion charts, word maps) that highlight trends.
Passionate about continuously learning in the ever-evolving ML domain and exploring new methodologies to solve business problems.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Strong collaboration and elaboration skills; demonstrates a strong commitment to organizational success; shares resources and leverages knowledge across the organization.
Adaptable and open to change
Individual Accountabilities:
Consult with internal business leaders and bring analytics driven insights to solve business challenges
Develop and implement analytics enabled solutions to improve customer experience, drive customer engagement, and increase customer value.
Review and analyze existing processes to identify customer opportunities. Work with large amounts of call center, web and other data sources to build holistic view of customer journey
Innovate and find creative ways to source customer data to support modeling efforts, utilizing structured and unstructured data using Big Data technologies and NLP
Calculate model impact/return on investment and communicate value analysis to partners
Peer review other Data Scientists’ work and participate in model and code reviews

A focus on growing your career path with us.
Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.

Data Scientist at Fundmetric
Fundmetric is a data generation ecosystem, designed to help nonprofits transform their fundraising. Our AI-powered platform uses machine learning to predict donor behavior and identify future leadership opportunities, driving more frequent and higher donations.
We work with organizations across the nonprofit sector, focusing on educational institutions, hospitals & health providers and general non-profit. The iteration of our platform is driven by our clients.
Objective:
We are looking for a data scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products. Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products. · Extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
· Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
· Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
· Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
· Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance
Skills and Qualifications

About The Role::
Journey is looking for experienced, energetic, data scientist with an interest in teaching. As a Data Science Instructor, you will be responsible for leading lectures on various topics, assigning course work, grading, and mentoring students on a 1-1 basis. You will work closely with other instructors and members of our education team, and follow along with our pre-built curriculum and teacher guide. You will work as an instructor for our Concordia Bootcamps program (a partnership between us and Concordia University) and have a direct impact on changing peoples lives through education.

We're currently seeking instructors for the following part-time bootcamps:

January 22 to August 31, 2023 (7 months)
Tue & Thu 6:30-10pm ET, Sun 10am to 5pm ET

January 21, 2023 to February 14, 2024 (13 months)
Mon & Wed 6:30-10pm ET, 8x Saturdays 10am to 5pm ET

January 21, 2023 to February 17, 2024 (13 months)
Saturdays 10am to 5pm ET, 8x Sundays 10am to 5pm ET

This is a part-time contractual position.

You can review the program and upcoming course dates here: https://concordiabootcamps.ca/courses/full-stack-immersive/ (https://concordiabootcamps.ca/courses/full-stack-immersive/)

Salary & Benefits::
$15,000 - $20,000 CAD for length of contract, depending on your experience (paid in monthly instalments)
Fully remote work
Work with an amazing and fun team
Possibility to extend your contract and teach more courses
Responsibilities::
Teach a class of beginners (in collaboration with 1-2 other instructors and the Lead Instructor) with the goal of ensuring they graduate ready for junior level roles in Data Science
Act as coach/mentor to students as they work their way through the course
Care profoundly about every student's success
Present lectures on Math, Stats, Python, Pandas, SQL, Data Visualization, and more
Communicate regularly with the Administration Team and Lead Instructor to provide ongoing updates on the students' process and feedback
Follow each student independently and ensure that they develop a mastery of the subject matter
About You::
Experience teaching (as a TA), coaching, managing or supporting junior staff or managing projects
Experience in the field of Data Science, have graduated from a Data Science Bootcamp and/or have an educational background in Data Science
Outgoing, personable, friendly and empathetic

Well-versed in both front-end and back-end development
Strong active listening skills and ability to motivate
Ability to help all students equally - both those that are excelling and those who are falling behind, with patience, kindness and empathy
Lifelong learner who loves sharing their learnings and experiences with others
Loves the idea of helping people lead better lives through education
Schedule Expectations:
Outside of the schedule outlined above, instructors should also expect approximately 10-15 hours of onboarding the week prior to the start of the bootcamp and 5-10 hours of grading and off-boarding the week after the end of the bootcamp. Job Description

Points is looking for a full-time Data Scientist to join our Toronto team on a permanent basis.
Fed by ever-expanding data sources across our product, partner and member network, Points is creating a world of advanced analytics that is real time, automated, always on and always learning. This collective intelligence is our unique offering - it enables us to drive unparalleled member engagement and program economics for our partners.
Reporting to the Director, Data Science & Analytics, the Data Scientist will research, develop & deliver best-in-class modeling solutions including pricing optimization models and personalized offer assignment. They will leverage data science methodologies to solve complex problems. In their work, they will provide guidance and coordinate with other data scientists to help achieve the goals of all areas of the business.
Responsibilities
Researching, designing and implementing advanced analytical models and machine learning algorithms that will be utilized for personalized pricing, promotions, offer generation & revenue optimization.
Using your optimization and simulation expertise, research and recommend the best approaches to solving our business problems.
Build pragmatic, scalable, and statistically rigorous solutions that can be applied across products and partners by leveraging or developing statistical and machine learning methodologies.
Continuously improve the models and algorithms by researching, designing and testing & learning.
Elevate the data science discipline by aligning with other data scientists on best practices, automation and standardization on all advanced analytical solutions, the end to end modeling process, offer assignment and personalization. Drive execution through fast iteration.

Qualifications
Over 3 years of experience of researching, developing and applying machine learning algorithms
Familiarity & proficiency with machine learning, optimization, reinforcement learning, big data technologies, predictive analytics, time series analysis, recommender systems, visualization tools with a solid understanding of best practices in data science.
Strong programming with Python and associated machine learning packages
Relational database expertise (SQL)
Ability to communicate/present complex ideas/analysis in a concise, business friendly manner
Natural curiosity to solve problems and find meaning in complex data sets, customer behaviour analysis.
Strong business acumen to apply recommendations in the proper commercial context.
bachelors in quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or other related field)

Ecopia AI’s mission is to create a digital twin of the Earth. Billions of geospatial images are captured every day by satellites, airplanes, vehicles, and personal devices - Ecopia leverages AI to convert high-resolution images of our earth into high-definition (HD) Vector Maps. These maps form a digital representation of reality and are embedded into critical decision-making applications, offering unique insight at scale. Ecopia’s HD Vector Maps empower a wide range of applications such as smart cities, insurance, real estate, retail, manufacturing, utilities, logistics, autonomous driving, and augmented reality (AR).

We’re seeking a passionate, talented researcher to join us at our Toronto office. You will have the incredible experience of working alongside our computer vision and engineering experts. Your work will have a direct impact on our end products which empower various real-world applications on a scale never thought possible. The position is permanent, full-time, and will have a highly competitive salary, annual salary increases, and bonuses.

We are looking for talented self-starting researchers, who enjoy diving into a subject and getting their hands dirty. With Ecopia’s flexible hybrid remote working environment it's your choice to work from home and/or our office, located in the beautiful MaRS Discovery District building at 101 College Street in Toronto. Come join us on the journey to map the world!

We are open to all qualified applications across North America. For qualified International applicants, we can support the procurement of work permits where necessary.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Research and develop deep learning algorithms to automatically reconstruct 3D built environments and understand 3D contents from geospatial image data captured by satellites, airplanes, drones, vehicles, and smartphones at a country-scale
Collaborate with the product team to transfer research into products that empower various real-world business applications

QUALIFICATIONS
Masters or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
2+ years programming experience in C / C++ / Python
Working knowledge of algorithms and data structures
Strong research skills in machine learning and/or computer vision
Hands-on experience and theoretical understanding of deep learning and representation learning

NICE TO HAVE

Publications at top venues, e.g. CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICML, NeurIPS, ICLR, …
Hands-on experience and theoretical understanding of multiview geometry and 3D computer vision
Hands-on experience with projects involving feature extraction, image matching, simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM)
Deep understanding of algorithms and data structures

About Us
Minpraxis Solutions focuses on transferring cutting-edge R&D into real solutions for mine developers and operators. As an award-winning Vancouver-based company we deliver transformative products and engineering to the minerals industry.
We are looking for a self-starting individual who is eager to apply their data science and signal processing skills to the development of an exciting new mining technology.
About the Role
This position is ideal for a data scientist who wants to be a part of a small and dynamic team. Working closely with the founding team, you will be working directly with the CEO, COO and a coder to help deliver a new and exciting product to the market.
If you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and wants to see the impact of their work, this is the position for you!
The role is full-time (40 hours a week) for a duration of up to 6 months (starting in early October, 2022 and ending at the end of March, 2023). The work will be mainly remote (ideally candidates are based in Vancouver) with some on-site (UBC Point Grey Campus) work.
JOB DESCRIPTION / WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
Your primary responsibility will be to assist with development of an innovative Minpraxis device. In particular, you will be:
Working as part of a small team to develop algorithms that allow for automation of signal processing challenges
Define and communicate developed algorithms for implementation into Minpraxis’ software (by a Minpraxis coder)
Setup data analysis frameworks and workflows
Analyze past data and develop predictive models
Develop 3D visualizations and summaries of provided spatial data
REQUIREMENTS
Highly proficient in data analysis, signal processing and algorithm building
Skilled at developing effective 3D representations of data
Well organized with good attention to detail
You work well within a team environment
Self-motivated, able to prioritize, and work with minimal guidance
English skills (ability to effectively communicate via written and spoken
English)
Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week
Essential Qualifications/Skills:
Degree/Major in Data Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a related field
Working knowledge of data science languages such as SQL, PowerShell, R and/or Python
Extensive experience in artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques
Experience with data analysis and signal processing for algorithm building. Examples of skillsets include signal filtering, convolution, denoising, detrending, smoothing and downsampling/upsampling
Experience with algorithm building for automation of signal processing challenges
Experience with visual representation of spatial data in 3D
Highly competent with data analysis and predictive model development

Charger Logistics is a world class asset-based carrier. We specialize in delivering assets, on time and on budget. With the diverse fleet of equipment, we can handle a range of freight, including dedicated loads, specialized hauls, temperature-controlled goods and HAZMAT cargo. We invest our time and support the employees to provide them with the room to learn and grow their expertise and work their way up. We are entrepreneurial-minded organization that welcomes and support individual idea and strategies.
We are looking for a Data Scientist who uses a combination of techniques from statistics, machine learning, computer science and data visualization to produce advanced predictive analytic solutions that determine patterns and relationships in large volumes of data to predict future behaviors, events and outcomes. The candidate will work cross-functionally with technical and non-technical teams to take on a variety of tasks including but not limited to mining data, building models, building dashboards, and conducting detailed analysis. The ideal candidate will have a analytical mindset, deep understanding of databases, visualization, and modeling techniques, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment delivering against tight deadlines.
Responsibilities:
Understand the business requirements and processes around advanced analytics model execution.
Collect data from disparate structured and unstructured sources in support of model development.
Extract data using data mining techniques to uncover trends and derive insights; analyze forecasting metrics,
Perform exploratory data analysis with the goal to uncover trends, find root causes of forecast inaccuracies and develop innovative features that can drive additional value
Build machine learning models with advanced analytics techniques to extend our capabilities and deliver new business value.
Capture and present data-driven business insights
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation
Work closely with software engineering teams to drive real-time model implementations and new feature creations
Leverage existing data sources, identify and mine data from new sources, identify opportunities for and execute primary data gathering efforts, and provide recommendations on scaling new methods more broadly
Requirements:
University degree or equivalent in data analytics, statistics, math, or computer science, with a minimum of 2 years relevant experience.
Excellent analytical, storytelling, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to translate/communicate analytics recommendations to both technical and nontechnical team members.
Strong understanding of quantitative (univariate and multivariate) analysis techniques.
Experience with predictive modelling and machine learning.
Strong experience with statistical analytical techniques, data mining, machine learning, and predictive models using Python, R or similar tools
Experience using scripting language for collecting, organizing and manipulating data.
Ability to work with data with significant ambiguity, develop creative approaches to analytical problems, and interpret data and results from a business/industry perspective

Competitive Salary

Career Growth

We are looking for our next Junior Data Scientist. Could it be you?
The Junior Data Scientist will be a part of our Marketing Consumer Insights and Analytics team. Reporting into the Director, Strategy, Consumer Insights and Analytics, this role will focus on developing and applying machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to support consumer marketing strategies at M&M Food Market. They will work closely with the IT, eCommerce, and Business Intelligence teams, as well as other key internal stakeholders, to research data science models and oversee end-to-end implementation. The Junior Data Scientist will lead research projects to solve the ongoing challenges while mentoring and supporting other team members.
Need more details? Keep reading…
The Junior Data Scientist will be responsible for but not limited to:
Define data science projects from start to finish, identifying opportunities, defining the problem, building a proof of concept, and deploying a data product to improve marketing, product development, or overall business strategies
Conduct data mining on customer, product, sales, assortment data sources for insights; generate hypotheses to test for opportunities to understand consumer behaviour and improve the merchandising and planning processes
Develop, monitor, and enhance analytical solutions and projects in collaboration with business stakeholders and IT professionals.
Apply a wide range of statistical and quantitative analysis in practical and valuable ways
Design custom tools to optimize data mining, cleaning, validation and analysis tasks
Develop tools and testing models to ensure data accuracy
Use predictive modeling to optimize marketing campaigns and customer experiences
Participate in design workshops and document business requirements and constraints
Program and write maintainable and well-documented scripts/applications for process automation; produce reusable machine learning pipelines while model building
Connect with other teams to understand the go-to-market process, product lifecycle, and product/consumer strategy
Create rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources; communicate results to senior leadership
Propose solutions and strategies to business opportunities and challenges
So are you our next Junior Data Scientist? You could be if you are a curious self-starter who is an insightful, results-orientated, and motivated professional with exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. You have a proven ability to conduct thorough analysis using multiple data sources, evaluate and present visual results in Tableau. The Junior Data Scientist requires the ability to understand a concept from a broader perspective with strong problem-solving skills. You are adaptable and love working with people and teams from diverse skillsets and backgrounds, in a highly collaborative working environment.
Experience, Education, and Designations:
1+ years of work experience in data science, preferably in retail food service industry including internships
Academic background in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Research, or a related field
Must have experience with Tableau and Python (Jupyter, NumPy, Pandas, PySpark)
Strong SQL and/or Excel skills with the ability to learn other analytic tools
Experience in at least one of the common data science toolkits, such as scikit learn, Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.
Demonstrated experience applying machine learning and data mining techniques
Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:
Strong problem solving and analytical skills including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization through Tableau
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including reports and presentations
Strong technical attitude – ability to turn business problems into analytical solution
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results
Ability to take on responsibilities and work with minimal supervision
Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships
Communicates with honesty and kindness, and creates the space for others to do the same

Job Title: (CAN) Analyst, Business Systems and Analytics – Direct Store Delivery (12 month contract)
Job Description:
Job Type: Temporary (Fixed Term)
Schedule: Morning, afternoons, evenings, nights
Position Summary...
The Analyst, Business Systems and Analytics – Direct Store Delivery will report to the Manager, Direct Store Delivery and will work closely with a team of Analysts to provide ongoing data support for the DOME Project. After the launch of DOME, this role will be responsible for assisting with the ongoing enhancements and maintenance of the system. This role builds out the entire tableau portfolio for the DSD program and will also provide analytics to the Walmart freight program and tie reporting, analysis, and results to the original objects.
What you'll do...
1. Project Management: work with competing priorities and tight deadlines, while overseeing a long-term project timeline and hitting milestones. Focus on the day-to-day task such as data cleansing, verifying, and user testing.
2. Schedule/systems/database/tool development: support with the development process of Project DOME, reflecting user needs in the product and responsible for future enhancements. Once the model is completed, the Analyst will support with ongoing maintenance and enhancements to the code.
3. Data analytics: extract reliable data from various data sources, including the Scheduler, WTMS, Helios, and CDL, to support Project DOME and help the business identify pain points. Individual will also be responsible for the build and maintenance of all the tableau reporting and business analytics that get shared with cross-functional business stakeholders. Responsible for producing analytics to optimize scheduling between stores and DSD suppliers. Analyst will be required to consolidate data and taking into consideration project parameters (zoning, municipality restriction bylaws).
4. Data science: proficient in data mining, data engineering, coding (including, but not limited to, Python, Hadoop, SQL, VBA, R, Excel). Pulling data from shared data warehouses, LSS database, Helios, FourKites.
5. Technical communications: work with technical and non-technical teams and communicate complex topics in a simple, concise manner to both audiences. Take data and articulate it into tableaus for use by business leaders, suppliers, internal stakeholders (merchants, SC, Replenishment, store operations).
6. Business judgement: provide adhoc analyses for business partners to establish and align on realistic expectations.
7. Design thinking: create innovative business solutions that address business needs with a seamless user experience that works today and tomorrow.

Data Scientist
The R&D team within the Health Data Products & Services (HDPS) unit at Loblaw is hiring a Data Scientist. Our team explores vast amounts of pharmacy data to develop insights and models to empower Canadians to take better control of their health, enable more access to health services, and improve health outcomes.

1-2 years work experience in health analytics and machine learning
Strong background in statistical analysis methods such as Regression, Classification, Clustering, and Neural Networks
Extensive experience using Databases, SQL, Python, Scikit-learn, and Pandas
Good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate complex ideas in a concise manner
Experience using collaborative coding and version control (GitHub, GitLab)
A passion for solving problems in healthcare using analytics and machine learning tools

Solid understanding of Graph Neural Networks, NLP, time-series forecasting, Spark pipelines
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Plotly, Tableau, and/or Seaborn
Familiarity with GCP, Confluence, JIRA, MLflow, or similar tools

Job Title: Team Lead, Decision Scientist for Cancer Screening Analytics
Job Description:
Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity.
The Team Lead, Decision Scientist plays a key role in leading the delivery of analytics products to support the Ontario’s organized cancer screening programs. This role will partner with other screening teams, scientific and clinical leads to ensure the success of cancer screening programs through robust analytics and insights.
The Team Lead is responsible for supporting the Manager, Cancer Screening Analytics in delivering the analytics plans within screening programs. As part of this role, the Team Lead acts as the lead support to the Manager in resource utilization and developing plans and deliverables and interacting with key internal/ external stakeholders. The Team Lead acts on the Manager behalf in his/her absence.
Here is what you will be doing:
Technical Leadership
Responsible for the successful deliverables of cancer screening analytics products, including reports, key findings, training materials and data requests
Consults and well versed in cancer screening programs
Up-to-date knowledge of the cancer screening data, indicator methodology and report requirements to successfully implement the analytics projects
Leads data quality assurance procedures to ensure the high quality of analytics
Operational Planning
Works with the Manager to define objectives and standards, prioritize key activities, assign accountabilities and develops deliverables as part of the analytics plan
Develops a detailed analytics plan which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project
Supports identification and development of new analytics products
Project Management
Provides the support required by the Manager to ensure the analytics project objectives are met according to set standards and within the prescribed timelines; monitors and adjusts analytics work plans to accommodate the change in work priorities
Acts within a project as a contributor who oversees day-to-day operations of the planning, implementation and tracking of an analytics project
Identifies improvement opportunities and escalates key issues/risks to the Manager; proposes and executes solutions to address challenges or mitigate risks
Supports the Manager in engaging the required internal and external stakeholders
Managerial Leadership
Manages cancer screening analytics staff, including setting expectations; allocating work; overseeing and ensuring the quality of outputs; scheduling and prioritizing workloads
Trains and mentors staff while providing development opportunities for staff
Provides the Manager with performance feedback of staff resources
Provides full scope of leadership including hiring, termination, and performance review
Supervises team members in a formal capacity by providing leadership and guidance on day-to-day analytics activities
Provides input to the Manager on recruitment, performance management, and training and development
Here is what you will need to be successful:
Education and Experience
Master’s degree in biostatistics, statistics, health sciences, public health, health informatics, epidemiology, information management or recognized equivalent
Minimum 5 years of health data analysis experience
Minimum 2 years of management experience
Knowledge and Skills
Proven knowledge of data analysis techniques, statistical methodologies, quality management philosophy, and experimental design
Proficient in Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive)
Advanced SAS programing and experience with SAS macro and SQL is required
Strong knowledge of reporting requirements and database management principles
Familiarity with CIHI DAD and NACRS, OHIP and other healthcare datasets an asset
Strong analytic, critical thinking, and problem-solving capability with excellent attention to detail
Demonstrate analytic experience and creation of information products for a variety of audience
Highly motivated individual, creative, self-starter with proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage competing demands
Excellent skills in communications and presenting materials through verbal, written, or graphical techniques
Strong interpersonal, facilitation and leadership skills and the ability to work within a cross functional team including staff as well as internal and external stakeholders
Familiarity with cancer screening or cancer in Canada would be an asset

Job Title: SENIOR MANAGER, DATA & ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) (Toronto, Hybrid)
Job Description:
Location: Pickering, ON, CA, L1W 3J2
Req ID: 40802
BE THE GENERATION to help build a brighter tomorrow.
Every generation has a challenge that defines them. At OPG, we are calling on all innovators, disruptors, thought leaders and change-makers. Join us as we electrify life in one generation and build a sustainable future powered by our electricity, our ideas, and our people.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, data science, advanced analytics, business intelligence, data, artificial intelligence, computer science or business.
Five plus years of progressive experience in IT strategy, governance, data, advanced analytics, business, or artificial intelligence.
Strong interpersonal skills; experience building and maintaining productive relationships and partnerships across the business with various stakeholders internally and externally, technical and non-technical.
Excellent presentation skills, with strong verbal/written communication skills; ability to build strategic and impactful communications and present to senior and executive management.
Experience working with big data environment; knowledge of data management tools, data transformation, technical analytics, data policies and procedures.
Experience leading digital transformations; with the adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) platforms and applications and machine learning (ML) solutions.
Demonstrated experience in taking a project from strategy to implementation; previous consulting experience successfully leading and advising cross-function, indirect teams of resources to execute high-impact projects.
Previous management experience effectively leading, influencing and motivating a team of technical professionals.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Understanding of applications, databases, data marts and data lakes.
Naturally curious, strong problem solver; ability to synthesize complex problems into clear next steps and recommendations.
Experience designing, executing, and continuously improving business processes in a complex and challenging business environment.
Strong business and financial acumen; extensive knowledge and understanding of business financials, budgets, legal concepts, commercial contracts, and laws.
Experience working in/for/on behalf of highly regulated and complex industries/organizations.

WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

ABOUT THE ROLE: As part of the CIO, reporting to the Director, Enterprise Digital Technology, you will deliver strategic initiatives to inform and engage staff, leaders, and key stakeholders; to advance awareness, and understanding of risks, opportunities with data and artificial intelligence; leveraging innovative technology and IT solutions to help advance OPG and its key strategic priorities.

You will also be responsible for building out and delivering OPG’s Data and AI strategy, building a team of professionals responsible for developing an environment that provides advice, internal consulting, and support to advance innovative technology capabilities. In this role, you will promote the company’s data and AI strategy and priorities, developing a data-driven decision culture while building technical capabilities across the CIO and the organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Data & AI Leadership: Develop and execute OPG’s Data and AI strategies and roadmaps, aligning technology priorities to strategic business growth, goals and objectives.
Thought Leadership & Business Advisory: Manage and grow an AI Center of Excellence, where the department provides expertise, consulting and advisory services while supporting the business need/project. Represent OPG with external stakeholders, speaking at conferences and events, and representing the CIO Data and AI business unit with staff and internal stakeholders.
Industry Best Practices: Actively monitor the market for trends and developments to prepare recommendations-experience directing data and AI processes, including developing, coordinating and recommending innovative approaches, processes, policies and procedures.
Data Analysis: Manage, monitor, and support the progress of various ongoing projects and initiatives exploring data analysis, from proof of concept, experimentation, and decision-making techniques.
Process Improvements: Develop innovative solutions and improve the efficiency of existing business processes, focusing on adding value and business benefits. Drive continuous improvement, curiosity, data literacy, and a data-driven, informed decision culture.
Project Management: In this role, you will manage a balanced portfolio of projects that span from disruptive initiatives to growth and innovative projects, ensuring each is prioritized and the continued cadence on each.
IT Governance: Support the establishment of standards, processes, and governance to support Data and AI capability within the CIO and across the business.
Financial Management: Assist with developing and managing the yearly budget to support the CIO, and manage the assigned budget for the Data and AI business unit.
Team Development & Management: Provide strategic direction, develop and supervise a team of technical resources (approx. four direct reports), ensuring strong performance. Develop through mentorship, role modelling and real-time guidance. At the same time, continuing to build engagement and curiosity.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU

This is an exciting opportunity to work in an environment where you will contribute to Ontario Power Generation’s continued growth and success in generating clean, safe, reliable, low-cost power sustainably. Here’s why OPG might be the ideal workplace for you:
Have an active role in helping advance critical energy projects that will make a meaningful difference in the fight against climate change.
OPG cares about the safety and well-being of our employees. It is our utmost priority.
We offer a supportive work environment where you can be your best daily.
Learn from the best; be part of an industry-leading innovative organization where you have access to opportunities across a diverse mix of work in the energy sector.
Competitive total rewards package with retirement savings of a defined benefit pension plan.
Be part of a growing industry where the demand for our power will only grow in importance as we further electrify the economy.
Flexible work arrangement and hybrid working environment.
Exceptional range of opportunities to stretch, advance and develop.
Work for a business that cares and is committed to building a sustainable future. Our public commitments help hold us accountable for OPG’s climate change plan, Our Equity, Diversity and Inclusion Strategy, and Our Reconciliation Action Plan.
Participate and volunteer in some of the many ways OPG gives back to the communities where we operate.
Be part of making a difference in the lives of fellow Ontarians and Canadians. Electricity is vital to the province, and OPG's clean electricity is helping decarbonize other sectors.

OUR PROMISE TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION: OPG is committed to accelerating equity, celebrating diversity, and fostering a culture of inclusion where all employees are valued, respected and supported. Appropriate arrangements can be made if you require accommodation during the application or interview process. If you need information in an alternative format, please get in touch with mailto:AODA@opg.com

NEW CAMPUS: In 2025, (OPG) is establishing a new corporate headquarters in Durham Region. The new campus will provide a cutting-edge work environment that fosters collaboration and innovation.

ABOUT ONTARIO POWER GENERATION (OPG): We continue to set the bar for environmental protection, community involvement and economic impact - all while safely keeping the lights on. Now we've set out sights on https://www.opg.com/climate-change/ and a catalyst to help the economies where we operate achieve net-zero by 2050.

OPG operates a https://www.opg.com/powering-ontario/our-generation/, including; nuclear, hydroelectric, biomass, natural gas, and solar. We are also a clean-tech leader and innovator, offering challenging and unique work opportunities. Help us use our power to change the world.

Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Planning and Analytics, this role is accountable to help develop and drive analytic reporting tools and capabilities to support the Home & Entertainment Merchandising team. You will support strategic initiatives and drive business performance through the development of analytical and reporting tools, lead data driven projects and connect the dots between data insights and business users. You will derive practical insights and make recommendations to support business strategy by compiling and analyzing internal, competitive and industry data. If you succeed at the intersection of data and solving business problems, and are customer driven, this is the place for you.
What you’ll do
Analyze data and recommend insights to solve business problems or identify new opportunities

Design, build, and publish various reports to provide insights and enable strategic business decisions
Build algorithms and tools to achieve business goals and improve existing processes

Job Title: Data Scientist/Statistician - Software Defined Vehicle Analytic
Job Description:
Job Description

SDV is looking for a dedicated and passionate Data Scientist with an extensive applied statistics background who will become part of a newly formed data analytics team. The SDV Super Cruise analytics team is focused on providing analytical insights about Super Cruise usage to several internal customers across GM. It is a highly collaborative, driven, and bold organization that embraces innovation and challenges. This position will play a significant role in our SDV family. It requires extensive knowledge of applied statistics, specifically: create and identify meaningful actionable statistics based on business needs, ensure applied statistical analyses are unbiased, accurate and precise, and identify problems, solutions, and opportunities from data analyses. Typical work includes collaborating with data engineers and other data scientists on the team within the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) to complete analytical assignments. Additionally, you will act as a statistical mentor/consultant to others on the team.

So, if you have curiosity and initiative for deriving insights from data and generating impactful business value, and you have experience in statistics, mathematics, and/or data science we are looking for you! Come and join the team that is shaping the landscape in the automotive industry!

Requirements and Key Responsibilities
Advanced degree in statistics, mathematics, data science or a related technical field
Minimum 5+ years of work experience in applied statistics or analytics
Strong expertise with the following statistical methods: time series analysis, categorical data analysis, multivariate analysis, and clustering
Expertise visually charting and graphing data to convey a story
Experience creating and identifying meaningful actionable statistics based on business needs
Experience with machine learning (supervised or unsupervised), statistical modeling, and text mining to meet analytical objectives
Proficient with one or more data mining / predictive modeling tools such as Python and R, as well as proficiency in SQL
Analyze large complex structured and unstructured data sets
Communicate an unbiased story using analytical insight to influence decision making
Collaborate with data engineers to build data and model pipelines
Experience with the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)
Work in a fast-paced agile environment to develop and deliver advanced analytics solutions
Cultivate an open and inclusive culture that supports learning and encourages collaboration
Ability to be strategic and tactical, with strong problem-solving abilities
Ability to independently manage high volume workload
Must be a self-starter and highly comfortable dealing with ambiguity
Continuous learning mindset - willingness to learn new skills and methods as needed

Experienced with the following is preferred:
Power BI
AZURE Cloud Computing Service
Software Telemetry data
Understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain
Experience working with distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and Machine Learning pipelines (Spark, DASK, Argo, etc.)
Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) certification

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteeropportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities. Should you be contacted by General Motors of Canada, please advise if you require accommodation. General Motors of Canada values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?

Data driven based business is the core in helping to use cloud native platform to serve tens of millions of crypto-currency users. Engineers and Data Scientists across the company use the data platform to do interesting and impactful analysis for continuous innovations.

As a data scientist, you will have the opportunity to leverage rich data (PB-level scalability) and state-of-art machine learning infrastructure to develop data products which are used by our tens of millions of crypto-currency users.

You will collaborate with a strong team of engineers, data analysts, business operation and product/marketing managers to define and build solutions, features, algorithms and products based off our rich data and cutting-edge machine learning technology.
Responsibilities:
Leverage of our PB-scale data warehouse to perform in-depth analysis to build personalized services and provide abnormal user automated recognitionDigital data asset
Obtain the blockchain based data to perform chain-based data analysis, prediction and recommendations
Data driven customer feedback and satisfaction analysis: leverage of machine learning techniques to understand customer’s feedback and satisfaction with proven data evidence and analysis
Requirements:
Project experience with developing machine learning models at scale,
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and mathematical underpinning, such as classifications, recommendation systems, optimization and etc.
Good experience with processing large size data is preferred
Good experience with Python, Java and/or Scala is preferred
Master’s Degree or above is preferred
Working at Binance
Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry
Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems
International work environment and flat organisation
Great career development opportunities in a growing company
Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career
Competitive salary
Flexible working hours, Casual work attire
